text: We ate here twice and both times the food was outstanding. The Kung Pao Hen is amazing, and so are the green chile grits. The short rib hash is inspired. Whoever is running the kitchen is talented. Love the well-restored mid century decor. The service is friendly, eager, and a little amateurish (forgot to bring my husband new utensils, cleared a cocktail glass before I had finished it). Nothing unforgivable, but maybe a little more training is in order.

So far, this is by far the best breakfast we have had in the area. It was a tad on the pricey side probably because it's in a hotel, but the food and coffee were delicious with generous portions. The service was wonderful. Hubby had the lemon cream cheese stuffed brioche French toast and I had an omelet stuffed with broccolini, carmelized onions and roasted tomatoes with a side of bacon. It was one of those meals that had us practically moaning with every bite 'cause it was so tasty! Oh yeah, free valet parking!

I live accross the street from this establishment. It is very good. The Bartenders and service staff get a "10". The food is very good. But they go over the top w/ some of their entree's.......I think they need to study the menu from Eddie "V"'s, "Paul Martin's" and "Bandera". Hello Prime-Dip's? But no Prime-Rib on the menu? They need to do some 60's classic's. For instance The "Wedge of Lettuce" w/ Blue Cheese. The Hotel is Retro, how bout Retro entrees???? "Rack of Lamb" Now how hard is that? Main-Stream soups........The soup's are ALWAY's to over the edge! How about Shrimp-Scampi ? Like I said pick up on the above mentioned restaurants you might yes you might get a great insight to what you need to offer..... Here comes another review from me.........

Took my girlfriend here for breakfast for her birthday. Thought the good reviews were worth trying somewhere new.  This was a let down. The food was average at best and the menu was very limited. Maybe my expectations were too high.  I ordered the eggs benedict and the grilled cheese.  The Benedict was nothing special and the grilled cheese was just horrible. Too much avocado and green chili made it cold and there was not nearly enough cheese. The bread was thick which made the lack of cheese even worse. My girlfriend had over easy eggs with bacon and potatoes.  Hard to mess that up and she said it was good.  I really expected something special and didn't get it. Service was good and multiple people checked in on us....So that was a plus.

We had such high hopes.  Cafe Zuzu was a huge disappointment today.  The decor was the best part of the meal.  From a lethargic, disinterested waitress to a kitchen staff that required 45 minutes to serve undercooked food to the only table waiting for service in the restaurant, it was just a sad experience for our family.  After waiting 40 minutes, we approached the hostess for help with where our food might be.  Why the hostess?  Because our waitress had become completely invisible.  We looked but could not find her.    When the food did arrive, it came in spurts.  With three people serving, you'd think they could get all the food out at once.  Alas, they could not.  We all had to wait another 10 minutes until the entire party was served.   Now for the food.  We ordered burgers, a sliced turkey dinner and some chicken fingers.  The burgers were the best of the lot, made with an excellent quality beef patty, delicious cheese and a tender bun.  The sliced turkey was god-awful horrid.  It clearly wasn't carved from anything resembling a real bird, but was some type of formed meat buried under a half cup of salty canned gravy.  An assortment of fresh steamed vegetables were the best thing on that plate.  A side serving of mashed potatoes was another miss.  Clearly reconstituted, the potatoes were tasteless and without proper texture.  I've had better when visiting Grandma in the nursing home.  The organic greens salad was excellent; not so for the torn iceberg salads which could have been made by a three year old.  The onion rings were greasy but good.  The wonderful salted dinner rolls were the hit of the night.  next time I visit Zuzu I may just buy a basket of bread.  Now for the final insult, for some reason, our waitress served us room temperature water without ice.  Who does this?  Why?  The management tried to make apologies for the kitchen, and we would accept them, if it weren't obvious that the problems with the food and service were not limited to our table.    Whoever is the manager of Cafe Zuzu, please take note:  you can do so much better.  We came for the wedge salad and great burgers and got "torn" iceberg (it was clearly chopped) and undercooked burgers that arrived cold.  Please, talk to your staff.  They're going to put you out of business if they keep performing like this when you're not in the building.  Hope you do better for us next time.

Awesome happy hour. Specialty cocktails are $3 and apps are $5 each. There is outdoor seating with a view of the pool and the area is nicely landscaped. When you walk into the lounge, it's like stepping back in time. Very mid-century modern.

Stayed at the Valley Ho a few days, so I had a chance to experience the Zuzu for all three meals. All of which, from what I ordered, we're amazing and extremely delish. The night coconut cream pie was the featured dessert was my fav. So delicious without being disgustingly sweet. The fries, salads, sandwiches, just everything I tried was good. The BLT and truffle grilled cheese are to die for. Even the side of asparagus was really good. Service was also really good and friendly.

We went there for lunch and it was excellent. The patio looked inviting, but we ended up sitting inside. The ambiance is definitely right out of the 1960's. You almost expect Dean Martin or Brigitte Bardot to be at the next table. The food was great and the servers eager to please. We'll be back.

About half of San Francisco descends on Scottsdale in March for spring training games so I made it a point to make a reservation here way ahead of time, sight unseen. From the outside, I wasn't sure if I wanted to have a meal at a motel, but once inside I'm glad we followed through. it was my dad's birthday so all the retro charm actually served up some good memories for him when he saw interiors like this the first time. I'm used to small plates meaning "several plates til you feel full." Here that meant two plates. The dressing on the kale salad took away any inherent bitterness and the lamb sausage had a great spice to it. The almond cake was moist and easily divvied up between us.

5 stars for brunch/breakfast! Went hear for a Sunday brunch while visiting phoenix. We've had our fair share of excellent brunches, so I was cautiously excited when I saw the menu which included toffee pancakes. Zuzu's food exceeded my expectations. First, they bring a variety of fresh scones to the table. They were delicious and could have almost been a brunch themselves. Our table also got both of the eggs Benedicts, an omelet,  and the toffee panackes. The pancakes were out of this world... must try! In addition to the yummy food, the hotel is pretty cool. Only annoyance was parking - it's easiest to just valet. The fee is free but need to tip.

When visiting on vacation, I'm kind of at the whim of my hosts (which is not a problem in the slightest). So I was taken along to Zuzu, located inside the Hotel Valley Ho, which I am warned is "retro." This is, in fact, the truth as the hotel looks like something out of an episode of Scooby Doo and the hotel like a malt shop where those meddling teens hang out.  Except, of course, for the full bar and menu serving more than malts.  We ended up there for brunch, where I tried the mushroom and bacon omelette, which featured fried onions and cream cheese. This arrived on a plate with toast of my choosing and potatoes. The omelette was good, save for very little cream cheese, and ketchup/jam didn't show up until 2/3 through the meal (a bit annoying). The jam needed pectin, as it was exceptionally soupy, and not very tasty (an apricot marmalade was the best I could identify).  It was not busy at all there, so the staff were very attentive. Overall, I'd go back, and probably branch out more into the menu before I rated this any higher.
Great service. Delicious bar style food. And the people watching does not disappoint.
Great breakfast. Lots of healthy options and prices are reasonable. Friendly servers and don't feel rushed.
Great place with a modern vibe and retro/70s influence. The cocktails were top notch and the food was delicious. Pricey, but you are getting a good atmosphere and good food and service.

If it weren't for the rainy weekend I may never have tried the restaurant on Friday night.  It was excellent, the staff was great.  The breakfast staff seem a tiny bit less friendly.....  not sure what's up with that.  Couldn't figure out what the happy hour was though.  May go back - may not.  The food was great, but would like a little more clarity on what happy hour is and would like to see at least an acknowledgement when you sit down for coffee in the morning.

There's not much I can say about ZuZu's happy hour that hasn't already been said - it's one of the very best values in town! $3 appetizers, cocktails, glasses of wine, and beers mean that you can leave here either really full or really hammered (or a bit of each) for under $20, including tax and tip! All the apps are a good deal and most are very tasty - the only one I wasn't fond of was the terribly over-salted chicken wings. The cocktails aren't weak like you'd expect for $3, and the wine selection is decent. The beers are the only thing that aren't a good deal, in my opinion - you can find domestics for $3 at many places even when it's not happy hour. After a long day or work (or play), you really will be happy after an hour at ZuZu.

No visit to AZ is complete without brunch at ZUZU!  I always splurge on an Ho-J---which is so good I'll never settle for an orange Julius again!  Never had a bad entree on their menu! Love this place!

I've heard so many good things about this restaurant that I was really looking forward to trying it. The atmosphere has a retro chic feel and has cocktail hour written all over it. :) I'm a sucker for 50's inspired design...Jacobsen's Swan Chair...Oh la la!  We decided to ring in Friday with lunch outside the office at Cafe ZuZu. I thought the menu offered a large selection of items from chili and salad to sandwiches and burgers. Prior to ordering, the waitress brought over a basket of rolls (or buns as we say in Canadian). They were a slightly sweet eggy bread that melted in my mouth. I decided to try the Seared Ahi Salad with an Asian dressing. The Ahi was prepared perfectly, slightly seared on the outside and juicy on the inside. It was presented on a bed of spinach, with yellow peppers and sliced onions - delicious! My coworkers all tried something different: Salmon Salad, Border Chili (which looked incredible), and the half sandwich with soup. From their response it sounded like the Border Chili was the ticket!  I was pretty impressed with my overall experience and will be back for cocktail hour! I give Cafe ZuZu four stars.

Absolutely my favorite place!  The service is over the top....they always make you feel like you this is your home. Travis is the best bartender in the whole wide world!  Miwa is an amazing manager and runs a tight ship. I hope this place never changes. Can't say enough good things!!

When we venture to The Valley Ho we're never disappointed. We joined Chef Chuck Wiley for the Monday night Chef's Table. The atmosphere was fun as usual, and the staff went above and beyond to make guests really enjoy themselves.  The menu was delicious, and the wines that were paired really complimented every course.  ZuZu is always consistent, and for that we'll always be returning guests!

I have frequented ZuZu numerous times for dinner with family or friends and never walked away disappointed. While the food is essentially simple it tends to be very well done as you would expect for the price.   The iceberg lettuce wedge salad was absolutely ridiculously big, I suggest splitting it unless you plan on grazing for awhile. The grilled salmon, ahi tuna salad, and beef stroganoff have all been proven to be consistent palette pleasers and the Bourbon Mac Daddy from the bar was perfect. Dinner service has always been prompt and friendly but not intrusive. Obviously, a booth is quite nice for a small party or a couple on a date, they are relatively cozy, somewhat quieter than the main floor, and have excellent lighting. The decor is relatively contemporary, as you would expect in Scottsdale/Valley Ho with a sprinkle of Frank Loyd Wright's influence in the central columns, but largely has a very relaxed and warm feeling. As a springtime alternative they also have a wonderful outdoor patio.  ZuZu is quite popular on Friday and Saturday nights thus if possible I strongly recommend reservations or trying to go on off peak days for a more enjoyable dining experience. If you do decide to pop in at the last minute and are faced with a consequential wait there is a very relaxed bar adjacent to ZuZu in the lobby of the Valley Ho which you could easily pass the time.   Cafe ZuZu website (menus and reservations are all online): http://www.hotelvalleyho.com/content/fooddrink/cafezuzu.html

Only giving this 1 star due to horrible WAITSTAFF AND HOSTESS TEAM. I brought my younger sister here for a birthday brunch with my mom who was visiting from the east coast. I saw the amazing reviews and raves about the Eggs Benedict, and knowing that was her favorite I had to bring her here!  I went to the restaurant 2 hours before our reservation with flowers for my sister, asking that they be placed at the reserved table as a surprise. I also asked that a cake (made by the restaurant) be presented directly after the entree, also as a surprise.  When we arrived, the flowers were not on the table... no big deal, I just thought they may have forgotten. I kindly asked the two hostesses (same as I had seen earlier) to please bring the flowers out. 10 minutes after we were seated, the flowers were still not brought out, so I went back inside and asked them again and they were brought out....  We ordered drinks from our server and after receiving them, didn't see him until we asked the hostesses for him to come take our order. Thinking he may be new, we put that aside and ordered our food.  The food came, and it was absolutely impeccable. They definitely have some amazing chefs and that should not be masked by the horrible staff they have.  I want to wrap this up by saying that the men who refilled our waters and cleared our plates were by far the best staff that zuzu has to offer. The manager ended up coming to our table and apologizing AFTER the waiter and hostesses forgot the cake after our meal.... surprise surprise at this point.  My mom and I spent so much time planning out the perfect brunch for my sister and it put a huge damper on the entire day.... just wishing they could be a little bit more detail oriented and not keep promises they can't keep. Didn't think we were asking much but obviously more than they could handle.

Had a good meal after a long day of traveling. The tomato basil soup was delicious and the beet and goat cheese salad had a perfect mix of tomatoes, beets, fraise and pecans and was dressed well.  I was dining alone and was quite comfortable which is not always the case. All and all, a good experience. I would eat here again.

My inaugural Yelp post! Yes, I did it for the free wine w/ check-in... Ha! Truffled grilled cheese, CA Benedict, homemade potato chips all exxxxcellent. Alyssa is a great server. Really all was perfect.
Got some late night desserts after eating dinner from the Herb Box. Liked their banana cream pie and rich hot chocolate.
Service was very slow, despite not being very busy. We were also not given the scones. The waitress brought the butter and jam for them, but no scones.   Food and mimosas were very good.

Things you might not know about ZuZu: - most ingredients sourced locally - much of the produce is organic, and bought seasonally from local farms - 95% of everything made from scratch in the kitchen including their awesome dinner rolls - pei mussels flown in fresh 3 times a week  Seriously, seriously good place.  I really like the effort the chef puts in about getting locally sourced produce and products when they can.  Also, everything is extremely high quality from the fresh produce all the way to the awesome desserts.  I would say it is like higher-end comfort food, but with special flair from the chef depending on what fresh ingredients he gets in.  Also, the price is ridiculously good for the quality of meal you are getting.   The name makes it sound like a coffee shop in the middle of a hotel but it is so not.  It's decorated mid-century modern and a very cool place for dinner.    Dinners are fabulous but breakfast is awesome too, and you can't pass up that make your own bloody mary bar.  Some things that are awesome: - The mussels, with chorizo.  SO good - Asian pear and endive salad  - Orange and ginger seared ahi - Grilled lamb sausage  - Caprese salad - the tomatoes are sooo good and fresh - Ho-J: This is on their breakfast menu and is basically an orangecicle smoothy.  Fresh squeezed orange juice and ice cream.    If I was a local, I'd be going here all the time.  Knowing that the ingredients are local and many are organic and that most everything is made from scratch just makes you feel better about the choice of eating there.

It's 1961 and we're having lunch in the courtyard of our Miami Beach hotel. Parker House rolls, sweet and salty, an open-face meatloaf sandwich with mushroom gravy. There's a surf board and a tiki carving amidst the flowers. But wait - something's wrong!! There's no humidity! Those are imported mushrooms in my gravy! I work to orient myself in time and space and find, what a relief, that I'm actually in Cafe ZuZu in downtown Scottsdale and it's 2010.   The Valley Ho Resort, which houses the Cafe, is such a wonderful period piece. It opened in 1956 and was renovated in 2005 by a very wise design team that left the mid-century architecture and spirit intact. Cafe ZuZu is at the far end of the lobby, and its charming patio is surrounded with flowers. The decor is late 50's. If you're as old as we are, you'll recognize it instantly. The menu consists of "Flavorful American comfort food. Familiar favorites with a contemporary twist." There are goodies like warm Maytag blue cheese fondue ($7.50), truffled grilled cheese ($9), beef stroganoff ($17), and (gross) tuna salad with cottage cheese which brings me back to my childhood a little too clearly.   While waiting for our entrees, we received a basket of Parker House rolls. These are the nice squishy white bread treats that, if you can manage not to eat them all, make wonderful toys. You can mold them into sculptures, or shape them into little round beebees to shoot through your straw. My meatloaf sandwich ($11.25) was served on a thick piece of grilled white bread topped first with melty cheese, then the meatloaf, then the gravy. There was a mound of lumpless mashed potatoes alongside. They were so smooth Ken wondered if they were made from instant, but they tasted much too good for that. The portion was huge, I took half home (of course I knew I was going to have dessert). Ken had sauteed liver, beautifully prepared, atop a mound of kale that had been cooked with high quality bacon, sauced with a Madera reduction. He loved it. I surprised him by ordering a lemon meringue tart ($6) for us to share. There were several chocolate desserts that sounded good, but I had a vision of the mile high meringue toppings of my childhood. The tart had only modest swirls of meringue, but it had been made in such a way that it was creamy, as opposed to foamy, and it was really good.The lemon custard was the star. I remembered a gelatinous filling, but this was smooth and velvety, with just the right tart/sweet balance. The pastry was a cross between cookie and pie crust, and stood up well to the filling.   This was not an inexpensive meal, but the portions are large and quality is excellent. Plus we had joined an organization called The Lunch Club, which every weekday, emails it's members a discount coupon for a restaurant in their specified zip code. So one of our entrees was free! (The discount coupons differ, some are 20% off the bill, others merely are for a free drink). But, to pay Cafe ZuZu the ultimate compliment - I'd come here and pay full price.
Pretty dang great!  Awesome spot for Sunday breakfast.  Love the retro vibe too.

First I have to say this is a BREAKFAST review, so I can't say I have anything but promise for a good lunch or dinner. Honey and I spent the night at the Valley Ho and sauntered down for breakfast around 9am on a Sunday. We were seated in a super swank booth immediately and had ice water and coffee within seconds of being seated. BONUS. Their silverware and coffee cups are so in tune with the whole VH scene, it just makes you feel...well, special. I wanted to steal the cute little teaspoons, but my Catholic guilt prevailed, as always. I ordered the banana buttermilk pancakes (a sucker for dessert for breakfast) and Honey got the Denver omelet. We perused the NY Times, had a refill of pretty good coffee (we are coffee snobs) before our food arrived which, in my assessment, was the perfect amount of time.  My pancakes were so pretty and seemed as happy to see me as I them. Outer edges thin and crispy, sliced bananas on top and...wait for it...a banana puree between each flapjack. OMG. Every bite was better than the last and I barely used half my ration of syrup as it seemed sacrilegious to mess with the medley of buttermilk and bananas in any way other than to fork it into my cakehole.  Honey's omelet was so vibrant looking which yes, is bizarre for an egged-up entree. But it was. The veggies were crisp tender and accounted for most of the ROYGBIV you'd want on a plate. Also the perfect balance of ham and cheese and served with yummy potatoes and lightly toasted sourdough.  All in all, we were very pleased and felt it was appropriate to return to our hotel room and nap off our fabulous start to the day. P.S. Dear Jesse T: ROYGBIV equates to all the colors of the rainbow. Beautiful work!

Great atmosphere and great food.  I ate dessert after eating at what was once open, Trader Vics.  The dessert here was great.  I had the special, the chocolate satin pie.  This was a very good choice.  I will come back here for dinner in the near future.

This chefs is world class dining at its best.  Our server Patrick was so awesome too... I don't think I realy need to say more, just that you are missing out if you don't try this place for a chefs table night!

I really hate that my 1st review is not a good one but the service is what is bringing down the rating.  The food was outstanding!  We we're seated pretty quickly but it took almost 10 mins to get a waiter to bring us coffee and then another 10+ mins to get any refills.   The food was perfect!  I haven't had better for breakfast!  I will try again but I'm very concerned about the level of service.

I've eaten here a couple of time for breakfast and lunch over the past few months. The food is good and responsible priced. The grilled cheese and their ice tea is my favorite though! The staff are always present and the atmosphere is laid back and fun!

We went for the happy hour and were NOT disappointed. The appetizers were delicious and cheap (highly recommend the grilled cheese appetizers... brie, fig jam and apples? Yes, please) and the drinks were more booze than filler, a great deal for $3 a pop. I left with a wonderful buzz and a full stomach for a mere $18, which is unheard of. The service was friendly and the atmosphere was laid back but fun.

Ambience five star  Cocktails five stars Service five stars Food three stars  We had a great time enjoying a strll around the very Retro Valley Ho.  We enjoyed Zuzu's ambience and hanging out in the lounge having a cocktail ...the dining room was exquisite...BUT the food was lacking. There were three of us.  We ordered the roasted butternut squash, the shrimp entree  and a Caesar salad with grilled chicken breast... We all felt the food was average at best. Enjoy a cocktail the lounge, but our recommendation is to go somewhere else for dinner.

First off, the ambiance is Mid-Century chic and inviting. We  had been here before and liked it so this time, we just stopped in for breakfast during  the week. We were not guests at hotel. We were seated, looked over the menu, made our selection and waited for someone to take our order. And waited. And waited. It was not busy, but it seemed short staffed. My friend approached the hostess to tell her we were ready to order. Hostess was polite and got a waitress to come to our table. The woman who showed up was rude and made no eye contact. Really bad attitude. When meal arrived, eggs were dry and on the cold side, "toast" was not toasted, just warm bread. We asked for toast to be toasted. The waitress said she would get another serving. Again, no toast, just warm bread. Belgian waffle seemed like a frozen waffle. Overall, an unpleasant experience with mediocre food and very rude service. Will not go back to eat there.

Vintage vibe with excellent food. The Valley Ho is one of Scottsdale's celebrity hotels from the 50s and 60s. It has been renovated to its original glory. ZuZu has transformed over the last few years from old fashioned comfort food to an upscale menu with a selective offering, but everything is wonderful. The ambiance adds to the delight.

As if the atmosphere in the Hotel Valley Ho wasn't already fantastic, this little area near the hotel' lounge and bar area is understated and upscale at the same time. I went for happy hour and truly enjoyed the options. I went with the ZuZu Senorita which was a signature cocktail while my friend got the sparkling wine, both $4. I liked my drink but the rim needed salt and perhaps a little less tequila (it was a very HAPPY hour). We each ordered a side. I got the prime rib dip and she orded the pretzels with chips and cheese. Each of us were in food heaven. The prime rib dip came with an au jau sauce and had the most melt in your mouth cheese on top. The meet was fall off the bone good and the bread was perfect. Two little slices were enough to satisfy a happy hour hunger.   I would def go back here for fancy drinks with a friend, hopefully grab a sit on the patio outside. Parking is complimentary valet and the car boys are very sweet.

The twice cooked fries are awesome.  The BBQ burger had good flavor, but was a little bit burnt on the outside.  Service was nice, but we didn't find out we couldn't charge food to our rooms until after they brought the check for our group (wouldn't have been a big deal, except we had been allowed to do so the day before when we sat in smaller groups).

My favorite spot to grab a drink after a long day at work when I'm going all by my lonesome! Friendly, attentive staff, good selection for drinks and they are happy to whip up cocktails that aren't on the menu. Not to mention the eye candy staff and guests! Def stop by on a weeknight for happy hour or during the late evening!

I absolutely loved the decor! It's exactly like my bathroom. The food was like what I leave behind in my bathroom. Having said that the French fries were excellent.   The staff was courteous and complimented me on my stunning ensemble, rightly so. They stumbled when they were unable to fulfill my request for water with aromatic spices. For this reason I would recommend using caution before deciding to dine at this location. The devil is in the details.

I'm obsessed with this place. It's beautiful and reasonably priced. I love to come here for brunch with the $6 mimosa and bloody mary bar. The bagel sandwich is huge and so good! The potatoes are delicious. I've never been here for dinner, but it's my go-to brunch place because it's never busy unless it's a holiday.

I celebrated my birthday today with 25 girlfriends at ZuZu and the staff and food was tremendous...big shout out to Patrick the manager and Matt (the server) and all the other servers.  Great ambiance...Great service....food was wonderful.  We all enjoyed it very much and the ladies were impressed by it.  The patio was a peaceful enjoyable setting.
Excellent. Look forward to going back. Great service. Cool restaurant. Almost 5 star. Reasonable prices.

We wanted a nice Christmas dinner with family. Instead, we received an expensive, disappointing meal. The cut of prime rib was amongst the worst I've had, and the sides were so so.  The  poor service and meal experience was inexcusable!

Very cool vintage ambiance! The food was delicious! I had the kale salad and my hubby enjoyed the turkey BLT. The fries were yummy with the Siracha dipping sauce! Would love to come back and try out the brunch and bloodymary bar!

A friend of mine took me to dinner here and it was great! I got the Scottish Salmon. The waiter and chef were very accommodating of my food allergies and made me a gluten free crust for the salmon. The waiter was also very helpful when my friend had questions about the beer menu. I live in the area and will definitely be coming back again!

Great happy hour. Burgers are solid and mini pork shanks are delicious. Although we sat at the bar, the service wasn't great as they forgot about us. But could have been just one of those days. But I would definitely try this place out.

Well we tried this Restraunt again after had great food but horrible service ....I choose this location for a friends birthday party this Friday the 8th out on the patio was super excited had forgotten about experience and guess what ??? Yes once again the worst most immature rude waiter named Brian the whole party was so disappointed but they could not believe such a great new little place had such horrible service and once again out in the patio area ..... As much as I love it here and would definitely recommend cause food and end environment is awesome I just won't go or invite my friends we are foodies and love to try new places and this his been sheer disappointment on service Brian needs to go !!! Sorry but its a fact ....so disappointed !!!

I usually shy away from expensive trendy restaurants but it was my birthday, and I wasn't paying.   The food was pretty good, not the best but definitely not the worst. I had a chicken penne with a pesto cream sauce that was really rich but flavorful. The chicken was swimming in the cream sauce, but still managed to be remarkably dry. I did like the addition of the sun dried tomatoes- they were a sparse but tasty commodity on the plate.   The atmosphere is really nice, it's dim and romantic, particularly when seated in one of the round booths along the back wall. The service is prompt and friendly, unlike many of the trendy restaurants in town. We were too stuffed for dessert, unfortunately, but it sounded amazing. We  did have coffee after dinner, but my espresso was a bit more bitter than it needed to be.   If you want to impress your date, this is a great place for that. Just make sure they aren't vegetarian because there isn't much on the menu for the veg-heads.
Fantastic Food, we stayed at the hotel for 7 nights while there for work and tried just about everything on the menu. Great cocktails too!

We went for Sunday brunch a few weeks ago. So unorganized. Staff mostly just stands around and is ignorant. What I think was the manager was walking around looking confused like she didn't know which way was up. Other tables seemed to be losing their patience as well. This place has so much potential. Sadly, it hasn't gotten it right.

We've eaten at Zuzu several times while staying at Valley Ho. Our favorite so far has been the short rib hash for breakfast. The Bloody Mary bar is also excellent but not sure if they always have it. My daughter loved the chicken sticks we had for an appetizer. Service and atmosphere has been really good.

Only been here twice but definitely going to be our new little getaway. Full bar with a nice wine list. They have a limited menu until midnight- appetizers, some salads, sandwiches, burgers, & couple entrees. atmosphere is great!
Not cool waited forever the waitress threw the kitchen under the buss all through service. Food was ok but they need to space out the tables wait staff is overwhelmed

service here is a joke!! the restaurant manager needs to be organized and not so frantic. the rest of the staff just stands around and socializes with each other!! the food isn't anything special. maybe I came on a bad day? I guess I will never know...
Excellent service. Limited food selection (one seafood, one beef, one chicken, etc. dinner item), but great flavor and presentation..

Executive Chef Chuck is one of my favorite people. So much thought goes into his cuisine. I have had many an item off the menu. The salads are the best in the valley. I now like beets because of the salad here. Drinks are Devine. Desserts are what dreams are made of. Happy hour is a hidden deal. Go here for a fantastic dining experience.

First time here. Read about their breakfast on a blog, and decided to give it a try. First impression was great. Free valet parking, and great service as soon as I walked in the door. The place was kind of empty, so I was immediately seated. The waitress recommended their breakfast smoothie, which was pretty good!  I ordered the Colorado omelette and red velvet waffle. The food was good; however, I wasn't completely blown away. The omelette and everything in it taste very fresh (not sure of this place is farm to table). However the red velvet waffle was mediocre. The creme on top was a little off. Needless to say, the experience was great and I definitely recommend eating here.

My friends and I have always loved the Happy Hour in the bar but I was disappointed last night to find out the menu has changed and our favorite beef and horseradish sandwich is no longer offered. My friend and I sat at the bar and we were surprised when the bartenders ignored us after they had served our beers. We finally had to ask for some food and although we both tried different items from the new menu, they did not compare.  Maybe it was because it was Friday night, but it was extremely noisy with people standing in a group or leaning across us to order at the bar. I have sat there many times before and have not had that experience but it seemed this group of young people were very loud.  Sorry to say I will have to mark this off my list of places to take my friends and to stop extolling its virtues to the people I meet.

I'm pasting the same comment four times so it posts as a review and not as a tip.  Really enjoyed the happy hour.  Ate a valley-ho lot of food.  Great drinks too.  Really enjoyed the happy hour.  Ate a valley-ho lot of food.  Great drinks too.  Really enjoyed the happy hour.  Ate a valley-ho lot of food.  Great drinks too.  Really enjoyed the happy hour.  Ate a valley-ho lot of food.  Great drinks too.

This place is a MUST for breakfast / brunch.  If you're a local, you'll feel like you're on vacation.  It's hidden at the Hotel Valley Ho in Old Town Scottsdale.  The atmosphere is clean and retro.  Great place to take out of town guests, and there's rarely a wait, which is great if you're cranky in the morning like me and need your coffee NOW.  Their menu is pretty expansive, there's something for everyone.  My husband gets the smoked salmon platter with accompaniments and I get the yogurt parfait w/ homemade granola and fresh berries.  Very high quality ingredients, and you can have a healthy meal without compromising taste and pleasure.    Very nice shaded patio with a view of garden-like flower beds and the pool.   I've been for Dinner on three occasions. It was fine - Let's rank it a three star dinner.  The parking is tough.  Either valet at the hotel (muh!), or park in the lot of the former Trader Vic's and enter through the pedestrian gate to the West, or park in what looks more like an   employee parking lot, directly off of 64th Street (?) and use the walkway east-ward.
In the Valley Ho hotel at end of main st. Decor to die for, space age bachelor pad extreme. Good bar and lounge, outdoor seating, food we had was 3 stars only, but ambiance made up for it.

My family and I went to ZuZu for Thanksgiving dinner and it was delicious!  The turkey was moist, gravy amazing and the chorizo stuffing untradional but very complementary! The server was nice and pleasent but I wanted to thank the manager Pete for making the dining experience very memeorable. He came by and talked with us, made jokes with my kids and I could feel he wanted our Thanksgiving to be  enjoyable.  Thank You ZuZu for letting me sit back, not cook and enjoy a holiday.

Every week or so we try out a different restaurant. Today it was Zuzu at the Valley Ho. What a nice experience! Comfortable booths and chairs, charming retro decor, great service and very good food. Loved the hot scones brought to the table shortly after we sat down. Our omelet and Eggs Benedict were tasty and my companion really liked the potatoes that came with his meal. We will definitely come again.

We came for Father's Day brunch on yelp recommendations and were not disappointed. From the valet parking to hostess to service, everyone was attentive and welcoming. The food was excellent and the Mimosa and Bloody Mary bar was fully stocked, clean and one of the best I've seen.  As long time valley residents (my husband is a native who grew up nearby), we were particularly thrilled to see this historic landmark refurbished and the architecture and style respected. We strolled around the grounds a bit and I have to say this would make a great stay-cation and was certainly a great place to come for brunch.
Awesome happy hour! I loved the tacos and the mild Asian wing. I also had the sazerac which very good! My husband has the cucumber fresh and loved it!

I cannot believe how much I do love this place. So wonderful it is. I feel like I am back in my childhood. Back to the early 60's. High end and living it up. The Decor is perfect! Every detail is Retro. The table is set old school. Just perfect. The Hotel itself is mid century modern.  But, original.  They should of done an episode for Mad Men here. Maybe they did!  We came here for my friends Birthday. Our food was magnificent, the service was wonderful, and the atmosphere was so cool it was hot!   Love this place. If I could eat here once a week I would. They even Valet your car. Love it!  All 4 of us loved our drinks. A gorgeous mint Lemonade, I was served Green Tea that was almost too beautiful to try. Plus, it was a great day outside. We dined inside but, they had the Patio open and it was wonderful. Since it was my friends Birthday, they treated him to a wonderful Chocolate Pie! It was so Good. We ordered one as well. It was delish and tasted very real.

We had an overall wonderful experience at Zuzu during restaurant week.  We had eaten here before but had been years and the new menu was quite enticing.  I had the vegetarian pasta which was light and had great flavors.  Two people also had the steak and said it was amazing.  And the 4th had the salmon which I also tasted and was wonderful.  The lemon meringue and chocolate cake desserts were very good. Amanda was our server - top notch customer service.  We also had 2 managers stop by our table who were very friendly and just checking on us.  It was a beautiful evening so we were able to enjoy their patio.  The best part was when one of the chefs from the kitchen, Tony, came out to check on us.  Overall great dining experience!
Service was amazing. The Martinis were fabulous, if the weather is good absolutely sit outside.  You get what you pay for.
What a fun place! We really liked the retro decor! The food was really good! Loved the Mimosa and Bloody Mary bar. It was busy and clearly a hip crowd staying there.

I frequent the Hotel Valley Ho Spa on average 15 times per year. I like to make a day of it.  After 3 downhill lunches at this last stop, I decided to update my review. Zuzu continues to blame the opening of their new hotel Mountain Shadows on the low performing, unorganized food coming out of the ktchen. Waited 15 minutes for a flat glass of champagne. Last visit ordered brunch California eggs benedict. It literally looked like they tossed the kitchen sink on it. Awful presentation. The muffin, which they are supposed to make scratch was small and tasteless, the butter sauce was swimming the plate the avacado was not sliced, but hunked on and cooled the eggs and entire dish. The side potatoes were burned and greasy. The waitor brought me new and it was deep fried.  Just aweful. Tried the roasted beet side dish and just like the Eggs Benedict it was over salted and a bit strange as it was hot from oven and all goat cheese gooey.  For a day at the spa with the extra treat of dining out...yesterday was my last dining tab with Zuzu. Again, this review describes this last meal, but reflects the last four  to six months of downhill performance and product.  Also, Hotel Valley Ho itself is looking a bit tattered too. To me, everything is slipping because of new focus on their Mountain Shadows Resort. I think this is a mistake and a huge business oversite. This place used to be great. The staff though is always friendly and prifessional. This food is now acceptable as roadside diner fare you might grab touring.  My expectation is much higher... kind of like their cocktail prices, which still settles around 11 to 15 dollars.  Before I would never mention because the food used to rock. Pains me to write this, but I have been giving staff feedback for about 6 months now. My spa days are officially getting shorter  because of yesterday's meal.  I will not be dining at Zuzu any longer. Final note to management. The menu Items have not changed. The menu is stagnant and has been since I wrote my first wish for rotating fare but gave high accolades years ago. I am not in the hotel industry, but one busy resort shouldn't have to suffer due to expansion of building another.  I am sad that my spa days will be shorter. It might even prompt me to find a new spot for massage and nails now as I like to make a refuge out of my day and to do that..I need to dine.

We girlfriend and I had dinner and breakfast here the next day. The food was wonderful, service was great. The cocktails steal the show. Very good. I had and old fashioned which was top notch and my friend had a delicious bloody mary. Wasn't cheap but worth the money.

I went in for brunch 2 week's ago and cannot stop thinking about the amazing menu offered.    They offer a great variety that include some of you traditional breakfast items as well some fun creative dishes.  I tried nearly everything in the menu and loved it all!!  The cinnamon rolls are filled with a gooey,creamy,sugary, buttery glaze in the middle.  Kill me now.  My life is complete.    The Chia seed pudding is ridiculous yummy and super healthy. Scones, yes.  Chicken and waffles, yes.  Deviled egg omelet,  yes.  Should you dine there today for brunch? Yes :) ask for Leila she's a sweetheart.

I had dinner last night and it was delicious! They bring out these awesome parker house rolls which are warm and delicious! We ate inside and the ambiance was very nice, they also have a great patio to sit on with a fire place lit during the evening. I had their special, which was the beef tenderloin with mashed potatoes and asparagus with some type of a demi glaze sauce. My friend had the Gala Burger and that thing was on point! The meat was delicious with the bacon jam and arugula made it tasty! We had Kate as our server and she is so nice and friendly! Will be coming back again!

This review is just based on our dinner experience.  The food was really good but the service was really bad!  I think our server was totally out of it because he made several mistakes with our meals.  Anyways.... the actual meals tasted good but I wouldn't go back for dinner.  My friends went there for breakfast, though, and had a great meal, so next time I'm there I think I'll try the breakfast or brunch.

My husband and I live in Old Town and Zuzu is our local go-to bar/restaurant. My very favorite drink EVER is their Strawberry Basil En Fuego - perfect every time! The food is awesome, I love the groovy retro feel, wait staff is very attentive and now this is our favorite place to take our friends! Who would have thought our favorite place in town would be a hotel restaurant! We even swing by for breakfast some times too! Last night we took friends there for drinks and apps, then took our 2nd round of drinks outside and up to the balcony overlooking the pool and grounds. Totally cool!

Best service we had in a long time! Kimberly took great care of us and always kept our coffee cup full. Highly recommend the Denver omelette and eggs Benedict for breakfast. Only complaint was the bacon tasted more like beef jerky. Overall this hotel is on the top of our lists for exceptional customer service.

Beautiful retro inspired atmosphere with a comforting yet playful menu.  Outstanding items include the pork chop, grilled salmon salad, and seared ahi salad. I've been here almost a dozen times over the past year and each time, the dishes are fresh and well prepared. The lunchtime wait staff tends to be a lot of new employees in training (or at least that's what I observed), but the service is still acceptable despite of this.
Price code should be at least $$$. $12 for a weak drink! Too pricey for what you get. Happy Hour menu may be the way to go unless you're on an expense account or a hi-roller.

Food is delicious and you will find a romantic setting if you come for dinner! I'm giving ZuZu's 3 stars for the less-than-awesome service.   But last week when we stayed at Hotel Valley Ho and ate at ZuZu's (once for dinner, once for breakfast) it was not amazing.   Our waitress talked to us in a very condescending manner--she was much older, and it felt like she was talking down to me and my husband because of our age (we're in our 20s, and have been treated poorly at nicer places before in and around Scottsdale). It was super bizarre, and after dinner, I finally asked my husband if he felt the same way. Sure enough, he did. Next morning, a different waitress is rude and doesn't even offer to bring us coffee when we sit down. We had to ask her for coffee when she wanted to take our breakfast order.   Don't get me wrong, ZuZu's is definitely worth checking out if you are in the area or if you are staying at Hotel Valley Ho! I mean, the vintage-meets-modern decor drawn from the original property is so lovely and rich with history, and the menu is great with delicious food!

Had to return to Valley Ho and Zuzus for another time.  Their chef is simply outrageously good.  The cheesy grits are so delicious,  reminiscent of grits in Charleston.  Eggs were poached to perfect and the house made English muffin..... Yum mm.

This review is for happy hour and it's very solid. Everything is $3 from 4-7. Three of us took down four drinks each and 4 apps and it was $50. Not bad at all. The Brie grilled sandwich was pretty outstanding and so were the wings. The French dip was mediocre, but hard to beat for $3. the margaritas were light and very good- tequila, agave, lime juice - better than most places! Definitely one of the best happy hours in town for food and drinks and service.

ZuZu has the happiest hour on earth from 5 - 7 (Monday through Friday). Sip on a hot and dirty martini for $3 with the Zombies as your soundtrack and take in the retro-sheik surroundings. Then cool down with the bramble (something yum involving lemon juice, blueberry and gin). The cheese plate and spinach artichoke dip are both a-m-a-z-i-n-g and will help you keep happy hour from becoming hammered hour. It's a must-do for reals.

Great eatery inside the Valley Ho hotel. Their prime rib hash on the breakfast menu was delicious. The perfect send off before catching our flight back home. Love the feel and vibe of this place. Love their service and convenient location (for hotel guests at least). Love their hours and menu items. Oh, and love that their orange juice is called the HO-J. Right?!  Enjoy!

Excellent food, our server was excellent and the lounge has a hip trendy ambience! Had the grilled cheese, tofu dish, asparagus, chopped salad topped with martinis...all of them were very excellent...highly recommend. This is in old town and nice place to get away from the summer heat.

I hope the food is good. I don't know if I'll ever get to taste it. The place is empty... I waited 20 minutes for their famous Ho J just to hear they were "out of the ingredients". Now, back to my eternal wait for our food. Oh, and my wife has asked for sugar for her coffee... 4 times! Disaster.

A nice space for a quick drink or nibble.  I stopped by here a few times during my time at Valley Ho and it was fine. I tried a couple of local beers here, unfortunately neither was really impressive, but the chips with guac and salsa were really fantastic! The chips were freshly made (although so hot we burned our fingers a bit!) and the dips were very flavourful.   The service was reasonable, and the space has a very cool, retro-chic vibe to it. I'll be back next time I'm at Valley Ho, not because it's the best bar I've ever been to, but because it's convenient, reasonably priced, and the atmosphere is pretty darn good for a hotel bar!

Can't go wrong with brunch here. We sit at the bar and have always had really great service. I love the BLT and my other half gets the Lox and Bagel plate every time. He loves it. They also do a build your own mimosa and bloody Mary bar.

It depresses me that I am so far away from this delicious and incredible restaurant.  I cam here for my bachelorette weekend (which I HIGHLY recommend!) and it was just fabulous.  We came throughout the weekend for snacks, drinks, lunch, breakfast and dinner (sounds a lot but there was a really good variety) and everyone was really nice.  The food - mmm the food!  Definitely stop by for their mimosas and you-make-it bloody mary (which was my first time!) great selection and you can make your own.  For dinner, I had the gnocchi app as an entree and it was delicious, decadent, luxurious and creamy - my favorite!  If you are visiting, living or in the mood for fresh delicious cuisine you must try Zuzu.

Cool: Funky retro furniture that looks like it could be  from the 60s. Not cool: Furniture that is so dirty it actually LOOKS like it's from the 60s and has been sitting in my parent's basement for two decades. Cafe Zuzu -- clean your freaking booths.  The first thing I noticed after sitting down here this morning was that the brown polyester upholstery on my chair was stained with -- milk? And then, looking around,  I noticed the walls of many of the booths (same fabric) were also stained. The carpets were full of crumbs and food, too. That's what I expect from I-Hop, not the Valley Ho.  My husband and I ate here for Easter brunch, but were overall disappointed. The menu? boring. The prices? OK, but a bit high for what you're getting. The service? Slow. The decor? Very cool. I'll admit, I enjoyed sitting in the cafe with glass walls that were open to the pool and the cool decorations. But that was about it. The menu was all things like "Denver omelet" "bacon and mushroom omelet" "scrambled eggs with grits" "pancakes" -- what is this, a breakfast join in Fargo or something? Really, that's the best you can do?  I really wanted french toast, but the only option Zuzu offered was "cranberry and walnut" - which seemed a little seasonal. As in, NOT the springtime season. So I settled for the eggs and grits. The grits were really good. The eggs were... well... scrambled eggs. They were fine, and all, pretty tasty -- but that's it.  I guess I just expected something more.  I was under the impression that this place was supposed to put a  "twist" on the typical "comfort foods" -- but they seemed to forget to add the twist. I could have had a far more creative brunch at home.

I really enjoyed the futuristic Jetsons style layout of this place.  I ordered the egg sandwich on a bagel.  The food came out quickly and to be honest that egg sandwich was so ginormous i couldn't finish it.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and we were able to charge the breakfast to our room.  I felt like a rockstar.  Can't wait to go back.
Another outstanding breakfast with superb service! Eddie was our waiter and his attention to detail is what I like to see. To top it off, I won a dessert for checking in!!

Love this restaurant.  I had breakfast, lunch and dinner and not one bad meal.  The miso glazed tofu dish is amazing and I highly suggest it.   The truffled grilled cheese amazing as well. The strozapetti pasta deeeeeeliiiiisssssshhhhh. The seared ahi salad yum.  And, if you are there for happy hour don't miss the pickled vegetable tostada.  It is absolutely delicious and super light!  Great appetizer!  Service is great, dcor is great.   This is truly a five star restaurant in my book!

Really enjoyed staying at the Valley Ho and hanging out at the bar in Zuzu. Great staff, sweet happy hour, properly made cocktails. Had the Korean wings with a side of ghost pepper sauce and the poutine. Both were delicious af. Had my first sazerac drink ($6 on happy hour) and it was amazing. I also had breakfast in the morning at the restaurant and it was also delicious. Well done, will be back!

Cafe Zuzu has undergone a huge and glorious menu change by a new chef. I was so happy to be able to try out their menu and some of my favorites were the lobster risotto, Scottish salmon the Show Stopper shake and the Ho-nut on the dessert menu. Their signature cocktails are creative and always diverse, there is something for everyone. I really enjoy that the menu is classified into different options now for breakfast/brunch, lunch and dinner. I'm excited to see where this restaurant goes and also to try all the delicious creations ahead. If you have ever tried cafe zuzu before the last 5 months and were disappointed, you should definitely come back and give it a second shot! You will not regret it!

It's the most wonderful time of the year! Not only is the weather FINALLY cooling down but it's also the return of Restaurant Week. One of my friend's had chosen Zuzu for a group of us to dine at together. First, notably was the ambiance of this restaurant; we had gone in at around 7:00pm on Saturday night. It was super casual and although we had a reservation, it wasn't too busy yet at the restaurant. At around 8:00pm, they started live music which was being played far enough away from the restaurant so it wasn't too loud but definitely added to the overall relaxing vibe.  Onto the food itself, we all decided to go with the Restaurant Week special. Two of us got the Butternut Squash Raviolo, one got the Blue Hill Bay Mussels, and another got the Kale + Brussels Sprouts Caesar. All of us seemed to enjoy our appetizers! I personally really liked the Butternut Squash Raviolo; it was a good size, had a tasty filling with a light sage butter sauce, and a little bit of crunch from the pumpkin seed + pecan brittle.  For our entrees, I got the Mushroom, Fennel + Goat Cheese Tart per recommendation of our server. It was a tasty option especially since it was vegetarian. The tart was tasty with the creamy goat cheese, mushrooms, and lemon + chive butter with frise on top. Since this was part of a 3-course meal, it was fine but the entree alone wasn't very filling. Others got the Manhattan Filet Steak and Hokkaido Scallops, which looked good and they seemed to like it.  Lastly, for dessert, three of us got Peanut Butter Cheesecake and one got the Praline Panna Cotta. The Peanut Butter Cheesecake was really really good! The cheesecake itself was creamy and definitely tasted peanut butter-y! The topping of lime gelee was interesting as it added a bit of lightness, plus there was also some crunch from the toasted peanut crumble!  The service the entire evening was also good. It did take a little bit of time for each course to come out, so I'd give myself ample time for dinner. Overall, a good experience, I'm likely to return.
Food was delicious! The server was amazing also! My fianc and I come here every year for our anniversary and will never stop.

Worst $12 chicken sandwich. EVER.  I'd give them one star, but I feel like I need to throw in one more, just because the decor was beautiful, and the weather was great on the patio. They caught me in a good mood.  We accidentally wandered in during brunch. We had already eaten breakfast, so we were in a tough spot. However, the waitron was kind enough to offer up some lunch menus. Good on her.   It was also nice of her to bring the flavored syrup for my soda separately. Now if only she'd brought the check in a timely manner when we were done.  I ended up ordering something off the brunch menu anyway -- a grilled chicken sandwich. Supposedly, it's topped with brie and arugula, dressed in a bacon dressing, and served on brioche.   Someone must've forgotten to place their Sysco order. Because, my sandwich was topped with cream cheese with some brie rind mixed in, and spinach. There were some cold pieces of bacon fat in there, that may indicate some sort of dressing.  The chicken itself was moist, but completely flavorless.The brioche had potential, but somehow it got soggy and gross.  Bleagh. I hate to say it, but I could have gotten a better chicken sandwich at Applebee's for $7.95.

This is an great spot for grabbing a late breakfast before hitting the pool at Valley Ho.  I had the red velvet waffles which were really good.  I'm sure when weather is good (it was cloudy and rainy) this place is jumpin before all the fun starts at the pool.  I'll give it another shot in the near future.

I like the atmosphere and that they allowed me to make a reservation. Their happy hour drinks are a good price, beer is probably over priced. The food happy hour menu is nothing special. Their appetizers on the regular dinner menu were really good but a little too pricey. I would probably only return for a quick drink at the bar with a friend. The strawberry lemonade was good.

I had breakfast here after staying at Hotel Valley Ho once.  The server was friendly, and the food was simple yet delicious.  Normally, I'm known to write longer reviews, but this time, just go to Cafe ZuZu, and you'll thank me afterward.

I've been here a few times while bar hopping with the Rage Cycles folk. We tend to be dressed ridiculously but there are all kinds at ZuZu. It has the kind of atmosphere where you can get dressed up just because or walk in casually. The bar always has a delicious drink specials and the prices are comparable to other places around town. ZuZu is actually inexpensive compared to other "fancy" looking restaurants/bars.   In all honesty, I have never eaten here but I've nibbled off of peoples' plates and the food is great if you're looking for bar food with a little flare.   ZuZu is a great spot to meet a small group or date. Highly recommended! And it's close to old town, which makes it easy to hop around to other desirable spots.

Wow what a great meal , planned to go to old town for dinner , glad I stayed at the Valley Ho ,. Had awesome scallops with deep fried lemons , perfectly cooked , arugula salad loaded with walnuts , Beets and Feta  , what a great meal , highly recommend this place and the Valley Ho  Is just a hip and funky hotel elite great rooms and staff
We had stayed at the hotel, but never ate in the restaurant. Boy was that a mistake!  This place is awesome and so is our server, Patrick.

I met a client last week at Cafe ZuZu's lounge and had a wonderful meeting. My server Nicolas Ray was very attentive and brought us water and some bread. He checked back a few times and refilled out waters. An excellent place to have a business meeting. Very professional servers and the atmosphere was inspiring!
A must for happy hour. Great deals on unique drinks and delicious appetizers... try the grilled cheese!!!!!!  cool vibe and good looking 30-50 year olds flock here.

My wife and I have stayed at the hotel a couple of times and really enjoyed the zu zu restaurant.  However this trip the service was lacking and kitchen kept getting backed up. In fact our breakfast took well over an hour to be delivered.  Our server never let us know that the kitchen was slow and we were left hanging.  After several complaints to mgmt we did get our breakfast comped which was the right thing for them to do.  Not sure if they have new staff or what cause we have had good experiences before.  I just hope that they get it figured out!

Beautiful evening for dinner on the patio at Cafe ZuZu. And a really good value considering it was AZ Restaurant Week.   Half price bottle of champagne got us off to a great start. First courses -- Wagyu Beef was perfectly tender and flavorful. The roasted acorn squash soup was excellent as well, with the cinnamon toasted marshmallows an awesome creative twist.   We both had the mustard crusted NY strip -- tender and tasty, but the star for me was the truffle mashed potatoes.   The Decadent Chocolate Torte was in fact decadent, an excellent end to an excellent meal.   My only suggestion is they need to up their game on the dinner rolls, but that was a minor infraction. All in all, a beautiful and romantic setting for a terrific meal.

During my 2 1/2 days in Phoenix at the Valley Ho I visited their restaurant twice. Once for drinks and once for brunch...  While we were there for drinks several of the Halloween themed martinis were calling my name, but I settled on a glass of Cakebread Sauvignon Blanc instead.  And it was perfect.  Gabi K and I considered staying for dinner, but Jared M didn't seem too thrilled with his pasta from there (even though he polished it off) so we decided to go elsewhere.  2 days later we were back at Cafe ZuZu for brunch.  This time the choice of what to order wasn't so easy! Wheat pancakes or homemade granola and fruit?? Decisions, decisions. Fortunately, our uhmazing waitress (wish I could remember her name to give her props) made the decision for me.  She offered to split the homemade granola, wheat pancakes and even a side of scrambled eggs among Gabi and I.  As our food came I had to take a call and when I finally returned to the table my eggs and pancakes were cold. Gabi mentioned that the fabulous waitress did offer to keep them warm for me, but she wasn't sure how long I'd be gone.   Everything was still tasty though- even when cold!  A fine option for those staying a the Valley Ho and even a good spot for locals to stop by..

My experience with Christmas brunch this year was a disaster from the start:  1) We called to make reservations at Zuzu a couple days before Christmas. When we arrived they booked us as a reservation under the Sands Buffet and were pushy in convincing us to go there. After refusing they finally allowed us to seat at zuzu, which I don't know why was a problem bc it clearly looked like there was space for us at zuzu.  2) The waiter brought out coffee and juice and spilled it on my cousin.. then after waiting forever for the mimosas and bloody Marys the we ordered, he spilled mimosa all over my friend's cashmere sweater.   3) Items from our order were missing, incorrect, or took forever to get. We were never offered refills on coffee or water unless we specifically asked for it.   4) I agree with other users the food was a hit or miss. My cousin had the best meal out of all of us dining.... he had a lox bagel, kinda hard to mess up. But everyone had said that the best part of their meal was the toast.  Also, I got the pork chilequile special and they basically dumped sauce on top of a tortilla chip and added an over easy egg, there was no evidence of pork at all so I politely sent that back. By the time I got a new entree I just had them box it up bc everyone else in my party had already finished whatever they could stomach from their meal that was not awful.   5) Instead of serving us the waiter was too lazy to walk around and place drinks or meals in front of us. He literally was on the other side of the table and reached across the table to give me my entree which I had to grab myself from across the table.  My family and I had Christmas brunch here in 2015 and we loved it so much that we decided to make a tradition out of it. After our experience this Christmas brunch we will definitely not be back.  Some of these issues were addressed with the manager who had provided us some compensation, which we appreciate, but definitely does not justify another visit to this establishment.

Excellent brunch experience yesterday! The food and presentation were out of this world. I had the California Benedict and my friends had the Valley Ho Breakfasts. I can't wait to go back. And the server MJ was "real". Made our experience the best in a long time. He even made the Bloody Mary from the make your own bar for us. Awesome!

It's been two years, but this burger ($14) remains top of the line. Cooked well done and topped with a giant mound of high-end blue cheese it makes for a delicious eating experience. Every bite is chock full of the cheese, grilled onions and bacon and the brioche bun was also a great fit. Another person just subbed the blue for cheddar and also enjoyed her "normal, not famous" burger. On this day, the chips outclassed the upcharged fries, but not by a huge margin. You can still get a free dessert with check-in, but no cheesecake was available this visit. The strawberry shake was more milky than ice creamy, but still refreshing and free. Will be back more often now when in the burger mood.

I've been coming to the Ho regularly since it reopened.  I frequent the bar, restaurant, spa, and/or pool area at least a few times a month - mostly for dinner or brunch.    The menu is mostly classic American fare set in a hip, relaxing environment.  The restaurant is perfect for any meal: breakfast, lunch, dinner, dessert, drinks, happy hour, special events- you name it, they got you covered.  Brunch: I'm not a morning drinker, but the Bloody Mary bar looks lavish - you could make a meal out of that spread!  To continue the indulgence, try the stuffed french toast or poached eggs benedict.  The cheesy grits are another guilty pleasure. Lighter appetites will love the breakfast parfait or sliced fruit plate.  The fruit is always fresh and beautifully displayed. On Sundays (I think...it's changed over the years), ZuZu provides complementary, fresh-baked scones with your meal.  Dinner: Like brunch, it's hard to go wrong.  Our fav's include the burgers, the chicken and penne, the artisan cheese plate, the orange and ginger crusted ahi, and the farm fresh veggie of the day (often I just order the veggie for dinner and steal fries from my BF).  The complementary dinner rolls are salty sirens of white bread goodness - take THAT you cruel, gluten-free world!    The ZuZu menu has evolved over time and for the better.  A few items we miss and would love to eat again include the happy hour BBQ spare ribs and the chocolate cupcake.  The service at ZuZu is impeccable.  My only minor criticism is the hostess asks me if I'm a guest at the hotel and for last name EVERY single time I visit the restaurant.  If you keep putting my last name into the computer, can't you see how many times I've been there?  I don't expect special treatment, but a simple "good to see you again! " would be cool.  The one exception is Esther, who works in the restaurant and always chats with us when we come in.  Those little gestures mean a lot.   Regardless we are TOTAL fans of Cafe ZuZu and the Valley Ho and recommend it highly to visitors and locals alike.  Thanks for making my neighborhood a better place!

Great food, friendly service, fabulous atmosphere! Went to Cafe Zuzu for Sunday brunch. The choices on the menu were so great it was really hard to decide what to order. The food was delicious and very reasonably priced. Our server was very attentive and made helpful suggestions. The Bloody Mary bar was great.  Lovely live music playing in the background. Fun 60s decor.  All-in-all, a fantastic dining experience!

This has got to be the best hotel bar/restaurant ever!  The food is impressive, but not too fancy.  The drinks are creative and classic.  Great happy hour specials!  I love this place!  Never have I felt so comfortable in a hotel lounge area.  When I am relaxing with friends and enjoying my cocktail, I feel like I am in my best friend's (with great taste in mid-centruty decor) living room.  In that sense, it is the perfect accompaniment to or extension of our hotel room.  Truly a home away from home and still a special treat at the same time.  Truth be told, I may be slightly biased as my husband and I got married at HVH a few years ago, however, we have been back to enjoy ZuZu and to stay at the hotel several times and never have I been disappointed.  ZuZu is the perfect venue for hanging out, whether it is after the most perfect wedding reception on the rooftop or an early morning family brunch.  We typically sit in the bar/lounge area.  There or from the bar you can order from the full food menu.  Bloody Marys and breakfast, brunch, lunch, and late night snacks, we've had it all.  The dip on the HH menu is the best deal yet, and my favorite lunch (or light dinner) is the chopped salad with a side of mac'n cheese.  Hubby loves the ZuZu burger and gets it at least once every trip; a new tradition that started on our wedding night!  But that's another story . . .

Having champagne taste but a Champagne of Beers budget is a real drag sometimes.   $15 mixed drinks can go kick rocks and $12 apps that feed one can take a flying leap. That's why I adore happy hour. Remember when Tempe Caffe Boa had a real, real good one? You got the hip but sophisticated atmosphere, great eats and drinks, and could walk away well-fed and pretty buzzed without having buyer's remorse the next day when you realized you spent your week's lunch money.  Well Caf ZuZu you are the new mecca for my budget conscious but discernable palate. I have always adored my visits to Valley Ho - I'm a suck-suck-sucker for modern design and dcor and a stroll over the grounds and through the lobby are like a Mad Men fan's dream: the cozy fireplace surrounded by couches for relaxing with your drink, the lounge-y area just outside the bar is intimate, comfy and gorgeous - appropriate for a date or a small gathering of friends -- the open layout means you can look from one end of the hotel to the other and all the way up to the third floor ceiling. The music was 60s lounge and energetic without killing the easy vibe. Oh, did I mention the $3 drinks and food menu?  This is really impressive. Three bucks a pop can get you a single serving of braised short ribs (juicy, tender and falling right off the bone), or some mini grilled cheese sandwiches of brie, green apple and fig jam (I'm a huge fan of Postino's prosciutto bruschetta, and this reminded me of that, the perfect blend of salty and sweet but even more buttery and savory, and with a hint of tart) or a decently sized prime rib sandwich w/ au jus...to name a few items. On the drinks side, I love the variety. Most HH mixed drink menus are all "martinis" that are neon green or hot pink and sickly sweet. Not here - get a refreshing Blackberry Bramble or Gin Fizz (that's two of six mixed drinks on special) or a glass of wine (about 4-5 choices) for just three dollars. I ate and drank to my delight and spent $15. Um, wow.   Service was great - friendly and competent and not at all weird about our ordering 2-3 drinks at a time to take advantage of the deal, or deciding to order yet another appetizer because they're just so damn cheap.  Oh ZuZu, thank you! Every pauper wants to feel like a princess, five times a week, from 4-7.

5 STAR! 5 STAR! 5 STAR! Wow... What else can I say? If you haven't been to Cafe ZuZu - what are you waiting for? I was sorry it took me so long to get there!!  The amazing, talented Chef Sean created wonders on a plate... Seared Ahi - Delicious Truffled Grilled Cheese - Outstanding Asian Pear Salad - Perfection (That was course #1) Brussel Sprouts Au Gratin - Mmmmm Crab Cakes over Cheesy Grits - Speechless Lamb Sausage - Oh so good Mussels - Seriously the BEST I've ever had (anywhere)!!  (That was course #2) Tropical Iced Tea w/Fresh Mint & a side of Simple Syrup -  Refreshing (Could not fit another course in... will have to go back for dessert!)  Well, enough about the food, let's move on to the atmosphere. Very cool, very chic, very retro (50's). We could not stop thinking & talking of ideas on how to bring more people here, i.e., family, friends, large gatherings, work parties, etc. We want to share the feeling & the fabulous food we enjoyed here. Not to mention, they try to source local, have fresh herb garden right outside the kitchens back door, and mostly made from scratch! The service was personable & friendly! And we hear they have a great happy hour during the week, which we will definitely be back for!  The team that put life back into the Hotel Valley Ho & Cafe ZuZu is genius! The place is simply impressive. A gem tucked away that should be admired, enjoyed & taken to the next level!   GO NOW! =)

My wife and I ate at ZuZu for Sunday morning brunch as part of a group of eight that meets at a different restaurant every month. We've been doing this for about 14 years. In recent times, places are very happy to provide separate checks. It seems that restaurant software has made great strides, so that it isn't much work to separate the checks. It wasn't always this way, so we appreciate it when it happens.  Well, at ZuZu it was like the old days. Our server said that he couldn't give us separate checks, but that he would take separate forms of payment. We've been to other places where they didn't separate the check, but gave each person or pair the total with the tax and tip included. This person just told us to give him payment, and tell him how much we wanted him to charge.   It felt like the restaurant management's attitude was, "It is too much trouble for us to do the math for you. You should be happy that we cook the food and serve it on the same day you order it. Our food is so good, and we are so cool, how could you expect more?"  It seems like this whole review is about money. That may be because we felt that there wasn't much to say about the food. I had the Eggs Benedict, which were small both in size and in taste. The grits, even after I added butter and salt, tasted like rice pudding with no sugar. Different, and uninteresting. My wife had blue corn pancakes, most of which is still sitting in our fridge. To be fair, the scones were wonderful.  It seemed that the food took a long time to come out, which became a topic of conversation in our group, most of whom don't usually complain about such things. The mandatory gratuity they added because of our big party was 20%. Most often, if there is gratuity added at all, it is 18%. For that extra 2%, how about separate checks?  So, while we enjoyed the mid-century chic ambiance, we were not impressed with our visit to ZuZu. We do appreciate how quickly they refunded the amount that we were overcharged when we called back a couple of hours later. That was nice of them.

Such a cool restaurant tucked in one of the coolest historic hotels in Scottsdale!   I went for lunch and the menu wasn't super big but they have some really great options. We started with the hummus plate and it came with warm pita and vegetables- very good.   I ended up going with the soup and salad which came with the gem Salad (bacon, avocado, cucumber, tomato) and a carrot sweet potato soup. The soup was amazing! Such a unique mix of flavors in a rich soup!   I would highly recommend zuzu!

The food is above average. I ate breakfast consisting of a denver omelet. I went there again for lunch and got the zuzu burger. The burger was a little heavy and greasy, but good. The service could have been better both times. They were slow to bring me my bill the first time and they were slow with service overall tge second time. They were not even that busy. It is convenient though being on the property and worth going to especially if you are in a hurry.

my wifes company has their Christmas party here at the hotel. They were amazing they dedicated an area in front by the fire pit and brought us some amazing cocktails not entirely happy about their version of A old fashioned. But the experience in the atmosphere was very classy. At dinner service was good we had a huge table of 14 people. Beef barley vegetable soup was very hearty and delicious. The Cornish game hen the way it was prepared was excellent and for dessert I had the lemon meringue tart that was amazing I pretty much ate the whole thing.

Our server was the nicest girl and she was really accommodating for us, she adjusted all of the umbrellas to make sure we were in the shade and she offered to take a picture of our group. All of the food was delicious and came out really fast! I got a milkshake called a Ho-J, it is like a orange creamy shake-heaven in a cup. Everything was perfect!

What a great happy hour!  We tried the green chili pork which was delish, we couldn't stop eating it until it was gone!  The bartender recommended that we try the mac n cheese because the chef had won an award for it.  It was really good as well but I am a big fan of the green chili pork.  I will def be back!

We live in the area and have always loved ZuZU. So great happy hour goes til 7:00 during the week, and Valley Ho is just a neat place. They've recently changed things up. Only "parts" of the patio are eligible for happy hour, the happy hour food menu has been drastically cut back. The beer selections on HH were cut back.  Wine is red or white. Pick one. The food is always good, but just let down by the recent changes. Not enough to draw us to HH there any more.

Instructions for a "funtabulous" happy hour in Scottsdale:   1. Go to Cafe Zuzu.  2. Have the delightful Lacey be your server.  3. Order any of the speciality cocktails on the $3 happy hour menu.  3A. In particular order the Bourbon Smash and Bramble!  4. Order a couple of noshes off the happy hour menu or even a "supplementary" item off the lounge menu.  4A. In particular order the barbecue mini pork shanks, the grilled artisan cheese mini sandwiches and the apple, endive, pomegranate salad.  5. Enjoy people watching in the crowded bar that magically empties out as 7:00p (the end of happy hour) approaches.   If you are visiting Scottsdale, as we are, and are not regulars at Cafe Zuzu, here are a couple of tips that might be helpful for you before you go to Zuzu.   First, web site ad aside that shows a young woman sitting with legs and dress askew, have no worries...you will not be offered a lap dance with your cocktails. (Although, my husband who wondered if this might be so based on the marketing photo on the web site may have been a tad disappointed. ;-) )   Second, you do not have to use the Valet parking at the Valley Ho to get into Zuzu.
