Self parking is available around the side of the building, a little hard to find but it's there.   Third, yes you really ARE going the right direction from the gate at the parking lot in the long walk through a sort of dark "tunnel" of buildings to get to the pool area of the Valley Ho where ZuZu is located...trek on intrepid traveler.   Last, if there is seating outside (not on the night we were there due to inclement weather) it looks as if that could be as much fun as was the inside seating! Even for those of us who are...ahem...more "mature" happy hour fans for whom the retro design at the Valley Ho and Zuzu reminds us of our childhood.  (And remember, all those younger people have to go to WORK the next day and we are blissfully retired. :-) )

Nestled in the beautiful Hotel Valley Ho, Cafe ZuZu seemingly has everything going for it.  The layout and decor is just outstanding, with uber-modern details abound.  I really liked the look of the menu which contained everything from signature dishes to old favorites.  Our service was pretty great, also.  But everything smells awful.  OK, maybe not everything, but our plate of mushroom grits (better in idea than reality) and my ZuZu burger reeked to high heaven.  I'm being completely serious when I say that I would hesitate to ever visit again based on this factor alone.  Clearly, I'm never ordering either item again, but now it seems like one big crap shoot.  It doesn't help that the burger tasted awful, too.  Our waitress gladly took it back for a replacement which came promptly.  Replacing their terrible, caked-on bleu cheese with cheddar was the best decision of the night.  Still, my backup burger came complete with a scorched bun, an obvious consequence of the rush.  I guess it could be worse.  They could have charged me for that awful burger I ordered and the mushroom grits could have smelled more like vomit.  Still, my expectations were so high and I left totally bummed out.

I've been to the bar twice in the past two weeks, just for a drink, so my review is of those experiences only. I cannot comment on the food. Both times I arrive at the bar and have a seat and there are multiple associates behind the bar that continue about their business and do not give us the time of day. Finally, after way too long, catching someones attention for a drink menu and then again, we wait for them to come back to take our order.  It was so bad it almost felt like we were being avoided/ignored. I don't smell. At least I don't think so...Maybe time for a new deodorant.  The consistency in lazy service is why only 3-stars.

You have got to be kidding-the menu is a joke. Beef stroganoff in the middle of August? Has anyone ever heard of a seasonal menu? We walked in, the bartender just stared at us. The host then appeared, oh hi! Our poor waitress... The whole experience was a scene from a bad movie. It did fall in line with a lot of the bad reviews we read. We could not leave fast enough. Highlight might be the bread basket. My shrimp tasted like cheap booze. Awful Awful.....
We were a group of 4 sharing several small plates. My rank order would be 1 burrata, 2 beets, 3 cucumbers, 4 himachi, 5 dates, 6 lobster roll. Service was a touch slow.

This is one of my favorite places in the valley for happy hour! The midcentury modern ambiance is sure to brighten anyone's day! Their large, open patio is perfect during spring or fall. They have delicious food and drink specials for $6 and under. The menu changes pretty regularly but some of my favorites have been the Green Chile Pork, House Made Potato Chips & the Slow Roasted Ribeye Dip {amazing!} For cocktails, The Bramble and Red Sangria are my top picks! The best part? It goes until 7pm so if your work day runs a little longer than expected, you don't have to rush!

Very cool bar in a equally cool hotel that is very retro and chic. Looks like you are stepping back into the 50's ... I kept waiting for the Rat Pack to walk in :)  Had the Negroni which I didn't like but that has to do with my personal tastes versus the bar itself as my friend said they were excellent. Very professional and friendly bar staff.   One of the coolest if not the coolest bars in Scottsdale.
If you haven't been to ZuZu at the Hotel Valley Ho in awhile you've got to come back! Chef Tony is amazing!

The service and quality of food were fantastic all while at an affordable price point.  I would recommend coming here with a group and sampling the shared plates (pasta hands down and green chili mac & cheese)

Seriously one of the best breakfasts I've ever had....you have to check out this place. Our waitres (Susan I think) was a nice older lady who lovingly referred to everything on the menu as her's..."I have the best coffee in town, I only use organic local ingredients", it was super endearing.  Fresh squeezed OJ that gets REFILLED...yum. Awesome coffee..and HOMEMADE jam that they make in house...seriously heaven. I went there both days that I was in Scottsdale, it was that good. Can't wait to go back to Cafe Zuzu's

Went to Zuzu to try their Showstopper Shake.  According to their social media postings, the share was available daily after 2:00.  We got their at 2:30 and they were confused that we had an OpenTable reservation since they said they don't take reservations in the afternoon and they weren't serving regular menu (huh?).  Didn't matter, there was plenty of seating outside, the weather was beautiful, and the lounge (bar) menu had sandwiches and apps, plus drinks, so plenty to eat.    We asked for the shake first, in case it was too filling and we couldn't eat lunch after.  The waitress came back and said the chef couldn't make the shake at that time.  What??  Since that was the whole purpose of our visit, I suggested to my husband that we leave, but he said we should stay since we were already there.  We ordered sandwiches.  Shortly after the waitress returned and told us the pastry chef COULD make us a shake (um, ok) so we ordered one.    The shake was amazing - definitely needs to be shared but presentation was gorgeous and it tasted yummy (we were there in Feb 2018 and shake was red velvet cupcake with cream cheese milkshake).  Not long after our shake was brought out, our sandwiches were served (really too close together).  Sandwiches were really good - I had California Turkey BLT and my husband had the burger; we both enjoyed our sandwiches.  Chips served with sandwiches were especially tasty!    Next time I will call to confirm when we can order the shake and we will order and enjoy that first and then see if we really want (can fit) lunch.  Our waitress was good but I feel like the timing of food could be improved.

First let me say.. Beautiful place, ambiance was out of this world, music and atmosphere was on point.. But this is a Restaurant.. And it started off good.. Great Cocktails!! Rolls came .. Ok Menu was Hmmm only like five six Entrees.. So not much of a selection..I decided try something different not a steak.. Oh was I disappointed.. Half Chicken no seasoning , the tomato something at bottom tasted like tomato soup and a waste of good hazel nuts thrown in with one small onion and Im not sure what else.. Husbands scallops over cooked and his risotto I think he said literally he was removing 1/3 of it because it was burnt.. I dont like sending dishes back because you just never know..Our waitress was great.. But Menu needs an updo..
Food was excellent and service by Eddie was fantastic! Thank you ZuZu for a great day!

The Valley Ho is one of my favorite hotels here. It has a lot of history (going back to the 50's) and a very unique look and feel to it. I was a regular at Trader Vic's before they closed. This was my first experience at ZuZu. I enjoyed a nice quiet dinner over a Moscow Mule and their popular ZuZu burger. The staff was friendly and the food was delicious. I love the outdoor seating area and the inside modern decor is just as amazing with all the colors and uniqueness it brings.
Excellent brunch. Sad they got rid of the short rib hash, but still tasty creative takes on classic American breakfast favourites.

Best Thanksgiving dinner in Scottsdale.  On Thanksgiving, I like traditional Thanksgiving dinner - not filet if halibut stuffed with carp.   Also,  great comfort food - chicken noodle soup is the best.  Dinner is very good from traditional to more inventive dishes.  Great service , friendly people.

It's a little off. Everything you think should be familiar and delicious, has a little mediocre twist on it.  I've had two seeming easy to execute meals that turned out not quite right.   First: a rib eye. How could this possibly be messed up? Easy... it's flap meat. What's that? The fatty part of the rib eye. I personally think they cooked a flat iron by mistake and told me that to avoid cooking what I actually ordered. Paying $6 for a side of mashed potatoes is kind of gratuitous   Second is probably the most egregious, over cooking the eggs on my eggs Benedict. Hard as rocks and almost no Hollandaise sauce. Dry as a bone.  The breakfast potatoes were inedible due to paprika over use.   Service was friendly.  Atmosphere is fun and fancy.   I also had a version of a Moscow mule which was delicious.   The appetizers that we tried were a cheese plate, which had good cheeses. But also we had a sausage plate, which had some gross and grainy sausage.

If you're searching Yelp right now trying to find a place to grab brunch, look no further! Come to ZuZu! You'll dine in mid-century modern style, be entertained by live music, enjoy the outdoor patio and feel like you're on vacation on some tropical island somewhere.   Once you're seated, you'll enjoy warm, complimentary chocolate chip scones, and they are SO good! The chocolate is all melty and I'm pretty sure I tasted a hint of cherry in there. We ordered coffee and champagne because, why not?! The coffee was VERY strong and I only ended up drinking about a half of my cup. We sprung for the Moet vintage rose which was de-lish!   Even though the menu is very concise, it was very difficult for me to choose what to order. Everything looked so good! I settled on the Eggs Benedict and opted for the cheese grits. The bene was cooked perfectly and the hollandaise sauce was amazing. But, those cheese grits were to die for! And I'm not typically a grits kind of girl.   Our service was just alright. We think our server had our table, which was located at the very back of the dining room by the kitchen, as well as some tables all the way out on the front of the patio, so sometimes she would be around, but mostly, she was not. Also, as she was pouring the last of our champagne, she poured the entire remains in to one person's glass, instead of splitting it evenly among the three of us (like you're supposed to) and claimed that the bottle was so heavy she didn't realize it was almost gone. Rookie move. And definitely frustrating since we forked out quite a bit of dough for that bottle.  I definitely hope to come back to ZuZu the next time I'm in town, though!

Excellent room service in 30 mins or less both times we ordered!  Had the famous Zu burger and a Salad the night we arrived at the Ho and then an Omelette and the Stuffed Berry French Toast a couple days later for breakfast.  Everything was delicious and of the appropriate temperature upon arrival... Visited the Bar for a night cap a couple nights of our stay and could not say anything better about all the staff at this joint!  They had a fantastic Reggae Band playing on Sunday which made the Ho pool experience exponentially more romantic then usual...   Should have liked to enjoy some of the 24 hour room service that was available but we had so much fun out on the town that we did not get to take advantage of this feature!!!  Note that the Yelp check in offer of:  Free Desert w Dinner Entree,  will not be honored for room service orders because that would be an unquestionable waste of good will...  Lame sauce!

The decor alone seals the deal for me. Mid Century modern, and the restaurant is done well. Favorite place to dine with one of my friends and catch up. Sitting in the booths makes it feel super private. The chopped salad is what I always get simply because I adore it. Green goddess dressing is incredible. They serve rolls and butter, and they are the real thing! A throwback for sure...super soft and warm! I might be addicted to iced tea (jury is still out) and I am delighted by how it is served here...big, tall glass, mint, a side of simple syrup for sweetening, and an iced tea spoon! It's the simple things sometimes that really add to my experience :) Not sure if they still serve this, but their cake & a shake for desert is to die for. Tiny chocolate shake served with tiny chocolate cake. Perfect little treat!

We ate at Zu Zu for the first time during Arizona restaurant week for dinner. Had a nice booth along the back of the restaurant, which was great. The patio looked nice,but it was too windy that evening to partake and the pool was still open and a little too rowdy noise wise for us. I had the Rocky Point shrimp & scallop appetizer which was a little like a gazpacho,good though. My DH had the caesar salad.  For the entree I had the beef short ribs with green chile grits, loved it. Not spicy at all,but flavorful. My DH had the Asian BBQ salmon.  For dessert one of us had the warm chocolate flourless cake and the other choice was key lime pie. Both were very good. A bread basket with nice soft rolls and butter were delivered to the table shortly after being seated. The salmon & short ribs on the regular menu were $29/$28. just themselves, so I  highly recommend in the fall you check out AZ Restaurant week at Zu Zu if participating or another restaurant. The meal was $33. per person and also included a glass of red or white wine or a beer. My DH had a jalapeno margarita($13.00) and I had the 2 glasses of red that were included. We used the valet parking option which was complimentary,but a tip is expected. I did not see self parking,but there probably was some somewhere.

What a fun little joint this is! During my recent stay at Hotel Valley Ho, I was able to check out this bar on two separate occasions. One evening we enjoyed the happy hour cocktails while enjoying the lively ambience of the patio. Our sweet server even brought us out an extra cocktail when a spare one had been made at the bar.   On the second night, some colleagues and I shared a bottle of wine in the lobby after an evening out on the town. It was such a fun and low-key place on a Tuesday night at 9 or 10 pm. I'm there are many times when this place is absolutely riotous, but it was the perfect speed for me to catch up with colleagues from all over the continent. I think the bar is one of the very best parts of staying in this hotel! Have your last drink (or two) just steps from your room? Yes, please!
We had a great lunch on the outdoor patio - the rolls are awesome, soft and home made!  The check need salad was good as was the entree, i would definitely go back to try one of their amazing shakes!

First off food was good, ordered the rib hash and stuffed french toast both were excellent. Others ordered the red velvet pancake which was ok, egg dishes were great. They have organic preserves which were yummy. Scones which they serve to the table for free were on point and good. They have a version of orange julius which you should order.  That being said the burgers had to be sent back because they were all well done not medium rare as ordered. Even after replacement the burgers were blah. To there credit the burgers were all free.  Service is the reason for 3 stars. They refused to split the check for 9 people on a business lunch. This overally complicated the check out process, the waitress not knowing how to proceed just decided to split the check evenly between us all without our consent to do so. This checkout process took a total of 45 minutes. Most infuriating though was after telling the waitress we were now running late for work she took 20 minutes to run 6 credit cards.  Overall food was hit or miss. When hit it was orgasmic. When missed it was edible which cost them one star. Next star for: Service needs to improve and basically ruined our experience. Message to manager: consider upgrading to a technology that allows you to split the check like Denny's or iHOP or plug in your restaurant.

If you are attempting to go here with a large group DO NOT bother!!!! Even though we asked for separate checks (with the understanding the 20% gratuity would be added to all checks) from the beginning the waitress could just not understand the concept or figure it out. We spent over 35 minutes trying to close out. And she still couldn't split the check. We ended up having to give her all the cards and split evenly. Such a headache and just ruined the whole experience. In my opinion the 20% mandatory gratuity was not deserved! I will not be coming back here.

My friend and I ate dinner here the first night of our stay at Hotel Valley Ho. Our server, Mare, was very sweet and helpful and didn't interrupt our meal, but still made sure we had everything we needed. The fresh, hot rolls served beforehand were delicious and my bacon cheeseburger was great. The bacon was thick cut and crunchy, just the way I like it. My friend's truffled grilled cheese was decent, not exactly what I usually look for in a grilled cheese (not very melty or grilled, and not a whole lot of gooey cheese) but it was a fresh alternative to a burger. We had a salad (mediocre) a few nights later and the mixed drinks were the same, at best. It was nice sitting outside once the sun went down and listened to the Beatles and Sinatra as we listened to the poolside's last stragglers of the evening.

Very chic yet relaxed spot for brunch and pool time.  Free delicious scones was a major plus! The food service was a bit on the slow side, but it came out very tasty. I was not a fan of the $7 mimosas... Just way too expensive for my taste. However, I believe you get a very large glass of champagne for that. We took advantage of the free dessert for checking in and it was soooo good!

It was a rainy weekend here in the Valley of the Sun, so we grabbed our umbrellas and walked over to the Valley Ho for breakfast.  And again, they out did themselves!   The ambiance, the decor, the vibe and the staff were AWESOME!!  I had the biscuits & gravy special, friend had a veggie omelet, coffee was perfect!!  Best breakfast place in Old Town !!

Comfort food in a gourmet style.  The atmosphere is great and the food is delicious.    The restaurant is in the recently renovated Hotel Valley Ho and they did a great job at creating a retro style restaurant with food worth coming back for.

This place has gone down a wrung from the last time I was here about a year ago. The food is still traditional and well-prepared and fresh and tasty. I do believe there is a chef back there somewhere who cares. The front house leaves more to be desired. Staff are courteous but there's a lack of consistency in professionalism. The booth seats were dirty, covered in crumbs and you could see piles of crumbs stuffed between the cracks.  I swept them away with my hands rather than put up a fuss. Our waiter was friendly though when he cleared our plates he left one small dish and a fry on the table. In fact he left the billfold next to the fry. Why didn't he bother really clearing the table?   The young woman who brought our food looked perplexed at what to do when she still saw us with salads. She took my dining partner's plate away (didn't ask) then I shoved mine aside. She took my fork. Didn't replace it. I had to scoot out the crumb-ridden booth and take one off another table.  Bread for the table was re-gifted. Seemed reheated, crispy and old.  This is elementary restaurant work folks. And we're dining, bordering on fine dining. Make sure people have silverware and time the meal delivery. Also in a fine environment don't ask if people are through so much. Plates are taken away when everyone at the table is finished. Otherwise one is getting dessert while the other is still working on a steak and then people aren't eating together anymore. It's simple dining training.  I actually found the service far below the level of the food. I would choose to eat elsewhere in the plethora of nearby dining choices than repeat the experience here, though they do a great steak and with a brush up on consistency and front of house professionalism I'd want to come back and pair it with my stay at VH.

Today was my second visit to Zuzu. I came here for the this month's Showstopper shake. June's is Strawberry Short cake. Absolutely delicious. The appetizers here are also very tasty. This is a chill place during their happy hour and we've had great service each time. I can't wait for the next flavor.

I'm local and live in the old town area, so we eat out quite a bit. We decided to try Zuzu since it's Restaurant week and boy were we pleasantly surprised! The atmosphere is very modern and hip, as to be expected from the Valley Ho, and the food was Outstanding!! Very creative and full of flavor. Since it was restaurant week we all ordered different things and shared to try a variety of things. We tried all the appetizers, the bacon pork loin, wagyu skirt steak and salmon for entrees, and both desserts. For appetizers I would definitely recommend the Lobster grits. This was a delicious dish, full of flavor and textures it pleased in multiple ways. For the entree they were all really good but I enjoyed the wagyu beef the best. Beautifully presented, with two types of potatoes including a mash and some shoestrings that reminded me of the shoestring chips we used to enjoy when I was a kid. For the dessert, definitely recommend the Meyer Lemon meringue. All I can say is.... WOW!! The perfect mix of sweet and tart, with some salty graham crackers and fruit for garnish. It was so delightful and enjoyable I wish I had a spatula to eat up every spec of this!! If you gave me a large bowl of it I would eat the whole thing. My mother in law who doesn't typically like sweets ate her entire dessert as well.  Overall a very enjoyable meal and would highly recommend. If you're lucky enough to read this review soon get in here this week for restaurant week to save some coin and enjoy!

The staff is friendly but the food is average.   Had a mushroom, cheese and spinach omelette but found no cheese. The potatoes were super flavorful, if not too flavorful, and had a nice crisp while not being too done or undone in the middle.   We had an average sized group (6) for brunch and the waiter made sure food allergies were accounted for. He made some good recommendations and informed us of the mimosa/ Bloody Mary bar when our bachelorette party started ordering.   Will go back, the bar has amazing cocktails, but I may research other brunch spots nearby.

I really love this place. We came for Christmas dinner with our family (2nd time doing that, by the way).  The service was impeccable, the food was scrumptious, and the atmosphere was very welcoming and serene.    The holiday menu was fabulous, but being pregnant there are only so many things I can/want to eat right now.  But for the holiday they had the regular menu available along with the holiday menu.  Our server was great, but very busy.  She had a lot of tables but she was easy to track down if we needed something.  I can't wait to come back for brunch.

i ate breakfast here the two days i stayed at the hotel. the decor lives up to the standard set throughout the whole property. everything down to the light fixtures is perfect. the food and service were terrible. to be specific, the water for my hot tea was room-temp the first day and cold the next. the eggs were cold and not tasted oily. the potatoes were underdone when we asked for well-done potatoes. they mischarged us on the second day as well. over-priced is to be expected at a hotel so that didn't shock me. what did shock me was that  could not find my waitress, ever. the breakfasts took an hour each and we were late to both of our morning appointments. the best thing I can say is that the bacon was out of this world.

I came here for breakfast on a Monday morning as I was staying in Hotel Valley Ho. It's in the lobby and hard to beat the value of being able to walk from your room.   They bragged about being able to eat 'poolside' and I thought I'd try to enjoy that. Living in Seattle, anytime you get sunshine is a good thing.  The restaurant is completely empty and I asked the waitress if I could sit outside. She tells me yes and to have a seat wherever I'd like and she'd be out.   She brings me a menu and I order some OJ. She comes back out and asks what I'd like to order. The process seems to be going easy and fast enough and I think "Huh. Not too bad."  One little sidenote: The menu upstairs for Cafe Zuzu in the hotel rooms had different prices than the menu in the restaurant.  I ordered the fruit plate and a cinnamon roll.   The waitress brings out my food & promptly forgets about me. One other couple joined me out on the patio and she only came out to take their order once and didn't return for quite a while.   It was so bad that I had to go inside after 20 mins to ask her if she could bring me my check. When I walked inside, the restaurant was still empty and she was re-filling the sugar containers.   I don't expect her to hover while people are enjoying their meal but I had finished my OJ and had obviously finished my meal and was just waiting for her to come back.   When she finally did bring my bill, she was just rude and abrupt.   Perhaps it is an Arizona thing but the servers and hotel staff did not seem pleased to be doing their jobs. And paying clients like myself are the ones who have to suffer.
Cozy cone, this place was very quiet and pleasant. We had a late breakfast here and totally loved it. Food was good, service was nice... coffee was soo good. I really enjoyed it.  Have fun

Stopped into Zuzu for a late night dinner. Our server Matt from Michigan was awesome. He was friendly and attentive. Service was 5 stars and food was 4 stars. Will come again just for the excellent service!!

I was staying at The Valley Ho & Zuzu is the hotel's restaurant, so it was very convenient. I sat at the bar & Lauren was the bartender.  She was delightful, very attentive & helped me pick out a delicious drink.  I think it was a cucumber cooler.  I also had the Turkey BLT, which was just as described.  Very good. Really hit the spot for me tonight.  I'd definitely eat at Zuzu again!

We went to this restaurant a few years ago for breakfast and really liked it. Now we stayed at the Valley Ho again and thought we'd try dinner. Unacceptable. Filet with Hollandaise was swimming in Hollandaise. More like Hollandaise with filet maybe? Probably it is supposed to be creative cuisine? But cuisine doesn't have to be re-invented. It's good or bad. This was BAD. Ingredients seemed okay but the cooking......the KUNG PAO GAME HEN  (crispy game hen, forbidden fried rice, spicy baby bok choy, roasted peanuts + kung pao sauce) was crispy all right....it was deep fried! I would like to know that when I read the menu.... We always loved the Valley Ho but now somehow lost interest in even going back to the hotel.  That should never happen in a hotel like this...

Came here this past weekend with my sisters bachelorette and the customer service was amazing. All of the staff was super accommodating and went out of their way to make sure we were having a great time. Not only was the staff amazing, but the food as well.

Husband and I went for tour at Valley Ho hotel and part of the tour gave us a 20% off meal. First we had a drink at the bar and was a very good and generous drink. The bar had fun vibe for hanging out. Then moved to a circular booth in the restaurant. I ordered the spaghetti squash. It was the best meal I have had during this visit to Az. It was very flavorful and satisfying. It had a spicy tomato sauce and had colorful small half tomatoes in the sauce that were cooked just right. The spaghetti squash lay upon spinach that also was cooked just right. The husband had the veggie burger which he liked and from the couple bites i had, was good. From what i could tell it was prepared there and not from a boxed veggie patty you can get at a grocery store, if ya know what i mean. I can't say enough how cool this hotel is. It's retro Mid Century Modern. If you are interested in architecture and design, the authenticity is incredible.  Good service throughout our experience.

Loved this place...the whole atmosphere.   Went there to watch a entertainer in the lounge and was unexpected surprise!   It's a boutique hotel!  The decor and interior are very cool!  Reminded me of a hotel in Hollywood,  California! Just had drinks, but I heard the food was good also.   Drinks were great.  Will definitely go back!

We made a reservation during Restaurant Week to come back to ZuZu after so many years to see if this restaurant was as good as we remembered it.  First off, it was not only restaurant week, but also they offered 50% off bottles of wine, so we enjoyed a lovely bottle of Mt. Veeder Cabernet for $40...what a steal!  I enjoyed the butternut squash ravioli to start, the pork chop with asparagus and polenta for my entree and the peanut butter cheesecake as my dessert.  What a treat and such a steal at $33/person!  This restaurant might become part of our regular restaurant week rotation!

Had dinner on Saturday night.  Cool retro decor.    We split a wedge salad and the grilled cheese.  Both were very good. My gf ordered the Beef stroganoff and I ordered the pork chop.  She liked her entree and I liked the pork chop until I cut into it and found that it was way undercooked.  The server and manager were apologetic and took care of me.  I changed my order to the fresh fish of the day which turned out to be good.   The mojitos were also very good.   We'll come back and try the place for breakfast next time.
Caters to party animals with managers picking their battles loosely.

Bar drinks, and atmosphere make this a three star instead of a two star.   Good for happy hour. Bad for dinner.  Service was adequate at best. Drinks arrived correct and timely, (we were one of four total tables on a Saturday at 7:30 pm), food did not take long, and bill arrived in a timely fashion.  We ask to see a Sunday brunch menu which never arrived, and the server had a slightly arrogant attitude which did not help. He gave suggestions when ask but very short with no description. Example, " What app is better mussels or tortellini?" Answer. "Mussels". No reason, no flavor, no added input, just mussels.  Food. The recommended mussels were the worst thing of the night. I had a terrible after taste on the two I ate, and thought maybe it was a bad combo with the drink I was having. Then my wife stated the same thing, and we compared the after taste we were having to a scent. I will spare you the scent but it was not something you would ever expect to feel like you tasted, nor want to. We did not complain however the manager noted we ate very few of them, and ask why. To my wives embarrassment I explained the flavor in with the scent we tasted, and had a laugh with him about it. I was not trying to be rude, just being honest about the flavors. (I was a server all through collage) He stated he would remove them from the bill, and took them away. I mentioned to him that we weren't upset, and understand this happens. (remember we did not complain, he ask). The mussels were still on the bill when we paid. My wife and I both had the dinner specials, which were pretty good. I had scallops, which all but one side of them were seared properly The sauce was great, and all in all good a dinner.    I had the Bramble from the bar, which was the highlight of the night for me. It is $10 regularly, however $4 on happy hour. Great drink Wine list was good enough, and very reasonable.

I only came here for happy hour.  I love the ambiance of this place.  Very retro 60's feel.  The drinks were a bit tart and nothing special.  I wish I was hungry because some of the food sounded really good.

Cafe ZuZu has a Rock'in BREAKFAST !!!! First, the BEST bloodymary I have ever had!! niiiiiice and spicy. The eggwhite omelet and the cheesy grits are to die for !! I wanna go back soon!!! Or maybe It was just too much vino from the night before..........Either way.............it hit the spot perfectly :)

One of the best "cafs" I've ever been to the entire staff was as friendly and fun as you could have ever hoped for! They honestly were one of the best parts of my and my groups entire night!!! I would absolutely recommend this lounge for cocktails before a night on the town!

We stayed at Valley Ho and ate at Cafe ZuZu several days for breakfast.  I had their delicious thick Belgian waffle w/ sundried cherry butter.  Delicious!  That butter is something else.  Even their syrup was good.  Not too sweet.  Just right, IMO.  The ambiance is retro-60's.  Love it!  The staff was polite and fast with the food and coffee refills.  Convenient and good breakfast food.

Coffee and dessert only review.  I love the lounge's mid-century" form before function" furnishings.  It isn't very comfortable, but not too bad if you're not going to stay for longer than a couple of hours.    Limited in dessert choices.  I had the peanut butter mousse.  It's like taking a spoonful of Jiff creamy peanut butter and coating it with chocolate ganache and charge $6 for it.  Hubby got the sundae topped with whipped cream and sprinkles...nothing to rave about.  I don't know what type of coffee they served, but they could use a better brand.  The three star was really for the acoustic guitarist duo who played all genres, unplugged.  They made the night fun.  I will definitely come back here again and try the HH nosh and drinks people rave about!

I hate to Give ZuZu 4 stars because their breakfast menu deserves 5 stars; however their lunch menu is very limited and could improve, for example there is only two salad on the lunch menu and out of that the kale salad is really bitter. The kids lunch menu is prefect and well made! The staff is also very nice and accommodating

The atmosphere was nice and had a mixed crowd. The lobster and asparagus grits were good but I did not taste any lobster. I got the steak option with the mashed potatoes and spinach. The steak was very tender and had a good taste. The chocolate tart was very good and rich. The only item I wasn't happy with was the bread. It seemed store bought and wasn't warm. I would not have gone to Zu Zus if it weren't part of restaurant week. Overall it was very nice.

This place is a total rip-off. Yes the food is really good however I called in advance to see if I can bring in a cake to celebrate my friend's birthday as we have a dinner reservation. They will not allow me to do this unless I pay their cake cutting fee which is $2.50 per person! This is very unfortunate as most places aren't this expensive with their cutting fee and will at least let you bring in a cake from outside as long as you cut it yourself. Very disappointing!
Stayed at the hotel and had to try this place out. The California eggs Benedict was so delicious and I will definitely be back to the hotel and this restaurant

My family and I headed to Cafe Zuzu for breakfast after reading good reviews on Yelp. We were not disappointed. The decor of the hotel and restaurant is fun - very retro - so the experience was good from the get-go. The food was fabulous. Can you believe a bottomless basket of delicious scones?? My daughter ordered the California Benedict and loved it. I ignored calories and got the stuffed French toast, stuffed with lemon cream cheese and berries. Yum! No butter or syrup needed.   On top of all of this good food, we decided to try a Frosty Ho-Jay. Wow! I will be ordering this again, but not when eating French toast.  Too many sweets. I wouldn't mind stopping by just to have a Frosty Ho-Jay on its own. It's like a creamcicle milkshake.  We will definitely be back and we will insist that any guests we have come along too.
Such a nice Intimate retro kind of hotel. Food is fresh and delicious...rooms are clean and comfy. We will come again soon

The food was ok. Not much of a big menu selection either. Ended up here cause the place I originally wanted to go to was closed on New Years Day.  Even though a certain site that starts with a Y and ends with a P that will remain nameless told me that it was open.  I will agree with other Yelpers about the ambiance being really cool. I'll go check it out again if I happen to be in the area and others places are packed. But I honestly don't see any reason to go there again.

Gonna have to rain on the breakfast parade a little bit, I'm afraid.  I'm on an unofficial mission to try all the great or very good or excellent breakfast joints in the Phoenix area.  On my Yelp search for a Sunday breakfast, I hit on Cafe ZuZu and decided to give it a try.  I wish I hadn't done that.  $27 later, I couldn't wait to get home to eat after the meal.  In order and succinctly:  Spicy Bloody Mary - decent tasting, albeit not very SPICY at all.  Came with a full stalk of celery, a wedge of lime AND lemon, and two olives. Problem:  it was MOSTLY ICE.  I got about 6-7 good pulls on the straw and it was empty.  And there sat a full glass of ice, stuffed in the glass top to bottom.  Look - I know MOST places do this, and at times I have even asked for NO ICE in my Bloody Mary.  I guess I'm going to have to make that a solid habit.  I don't like getting so obviously ripped off.  I work hard for my money, and I don't appreciate having to pay $6.50 for 75 cents worth of Bloody Mary contents.  Side of Thick Cut Virginia Bacon - very nice taste, cooked about right.  This was the highlight of the meal.  Breakfast Casserole - my SORE point, even more-so than the Bloody Mary.  It was advertised in the menu as this: "sweet Italian sausage, roasted potatoes, bell peppers, mushrooms, onions, tomatoes + cheddar, topped with a poached egg (or substitute sour cream for egg)"  All that WAS true.  But here's the MAJOR PROBLEM:  the amount of "sweet Italian sausage" was about the size of two quarters.  I'm not kidding.  There were 4 thinly sliced slivers of sausage, about the thickness and size of half a quarter dollar each.  That was it for the sausage.  The dish was SMALL too, about the size of my hand and not much thicker.  It was mostly green, red, and yellow bell pepper.  Mushrooms were good, what there were of them. The roasted potatoes portion consisted of about 3 medium-sized potato wedges.  Here's how they made it:  Cut all the veggies,add the two tiny slices of sausage, and cover it with cheddar.  Nuke, then add a poached egg on top.  It was something I could make at my house, but never would, because there was no seasonings involved.  Just the ingredients, smothered with melted cheddar.  Not creative, and not very tasty at ALL.  Felt ripped off at $11.75.  Ambiance and setting was good. The facility is nice.  The service was good.  The food and the lack of value are what ruined this meal.  But if you can't bring me some tasty. memorable (in a GOOD way) food, then I'm not going to be coming back.

The Red Velvet Waffle is a must! Hands down it is my favorite brunch item. The berry & chocolate chip biscuits they serve are also delish!  If you're a bacon fan, I recommend ordering a side.   Our waitress was attentive and pleasant. Will be back if only for the waffle and biscuits.
Had lunch here for work and really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna Salad.  It was so fresh and delicious! My coworker ordered the Rubin sandwich and said it was very good! Def going back for dinner!

A pricey endevor to come here for breakfast and drinks.  Good, but pricey.  The stuffed french toast was very good, as well as the eggs benedict.  I like that they serve gritts, even though I don't personally like to eat them.   Bloody Mary's and mimosas were tasty.  I've been back, it's kind of a fun place to take visiting guests.
Been here for brunch twice in the last while and it has been awesome. Service is good and each item I've had and the others with me were great. Very laid back. Great for Sunday brunch

It's a shame. Disappointed.  I wish they would stop changing the Happy Hour menu. In my opinion, they used to have the best HH menu in all of AZ.  They have now changed it yet again, doubled in prices, and the selections were unworthy.    Not sure why they always try to fix what is not broken.  Please bring back the Chicken Drumettes with the honey bourbon sauce, the Artisan Grilled Cheese with the brie and fig jam, and The Prime Rib Dip which was to die for.

If you don't want to go to bed drunk on an empty stomach while staying at the Valley Ho, I highly recommend the fries with the sriracha aoli! If you're still not drunk enough, order a dirty martini while you wait for your fries.

Wow..I can't believe the level of disappointment... First, we eat out quite frequently, yet, don't bring snobbery to the evaluation. So, yes, our waitress was very nice and accommodating, yet, the food, the drinks...set a new low in our book. My daughter ordered the grilled salmon and it arrived, swamped in some kind of relish mixture.  Even though famished, she had to back off after a few bites. I ordered the chicken lettuce wraps and was greeted by 3 pieces of dehydrated iceberg lettuce, along with some kind of crusty chicken mixture..I quickly returned  it, a behavior I rarely exercise. The Long Island I consumed clearly was created from cheap alcohol blends and other than the delicious French fries, this meal set a new standard for "low". Ambiance is the only salvation and garnered the 2nd star. Stay away..you have been warned. Only eat this food if you are deeply intoxicated and have lost the capacity to be discriminate.

I stopped by ZuZu this past weekend to get a showstopper shake for dessert. It was super delicious and possibly the cutest thing ever! Can't wait to come back for dinner.  It was nice that you can sit in the bar area but still have access to the entire ZuZu menu!

Went here for our anniversary with friends. I posted pictures. I apologize that they're half-eaten and upside down, but hey, at least I got a few before we finished the meal. I can't count how many times I've done that.  Had the chicken picatta, which was excellent. Others had the chicken and penne, stroganoff, and ribeye. Prices are a little steep (about 20 bucks on average), but they are typical for a resort restaurant. Excellent service--she even cracked a joke (on me!).  The lounge area is great and the bartenders enjoyable. We went to the lounge bar before dinner and for a night cap every night we stayed at the Ho.  Highly recommend.
Food was delicious, service was excellent! They have a great brunch menu and I love the decor!

Meet George Jetson!  This classic cartoon song kept replaying in my head as we spent time at ZuZu!  I love the retro look of this place!  When I visit family in Scottsdale I often find myself spending time at this hotel sitting at the pool and ordering drinks and lunch!  The pool is open to the public as long as you are buying food or drinks, and the retro feel just adds to the fun! ZuZu is no different!  From the time you walk in to the time you are leaving, it is just plain fun for me!  We dined at ZuZu on a Saturday night, so we were sure to make reservations.  I had not eaten at the restaurant previously, again only at the pool which is a completely different menu.  We had reservations at 6:30, but decided to go early to have happy hour cocktails in the lounge.  The staff and bartenders are welcoming and friendly.  The lounge was very crowded but we did manage to find a table to enjoy our drinks. Headed to the restaurant at 6:30 and our table was waiting for us.  Our waitress was very knowledgeable and offered advice when asked.  Most of us ordered the short ribs. The short ribs were ancho chile braised with creamy green chile grits.  They arrived steaming hot and fork tender!  They had so much flavor that each bite was a delight!!  The grits were amazing as well. I had also discovered that by checking in on Yelp you received a free dessert.  I had absolutely no room for dessert, but our waitress was more than happy to box it up for me!  I ordered the Key Lime Pie and really enjoyed it later.  Perfectly tangy but not over tart. All in all I loved this dining experience.  It may be slightly higher priced than other restaurants, but that is to be expected in a hotel resort restaurant, and in my opinion was worth every penny!

This is a rare instance when I don't always think my meal is 5-star worthy, but I cannot drop a star.  I love ZuZu that much!  I don't go that often, but I'm always reminded why I should.  Actually, I'm reminded whenever I watch It's A Wonderful Life  I am finally learning that for dinner I should stick with the beef stroganoff.  As much as I have enjoyed other meals, I always miss having that sin on a plate.  And where else are you going to find that dish anymore?  My only criticism is sometimes they don't drain the noodles enough, and there's too much water in the bowl.  But even that can't ruin the rich mushroom sauce with the pint of sour cream on top just waiting for me to marry the two.  Enough for two meals!  My 2013 resolution?  Go to ZuZu outside the month of December.

My wife and I spent a weekend at the Valley Ho recently so we decided to try the restaurant especially because of all the good reviews here on Yelp.  We didn't have reservations but we were directed to a table in the lounge bar which features the same menu which by the way is quite varied from simple sandwiches to gourmet entrees.  Our table was directly across from the lengthy mid century bar so it was perfect for people watching.  The crowd was noticeably upscale, well dressed and surprisingly young for what amounts to an "old fashioned" hotel.  Perhaps young people admire the fun and hope filled 60's when dressing nicely was expected and cocktails were king.  I had a pastrami sandwich and a beer which was real good.  My wife loved their kale salad even though I don't get the attraction or popularity of that green leafy stuff.  It appeared to be a nicely prepared salad with loads of salady accoutrements and a tasty dressing.  This is a fun place to go to.

How many times have you been seated at a table in an interesting, well reviewed or recommended restaurant, been handed a menu and went about selecting your meal?  Have you ever wondered what goes on behind the scenes? Wanted to know what goes into getting food on your plate?  As an avid foodie this is something that is always on my mind so when Chef Sean Currid of Cafe ZuZu at Scottsdale, Arizona's Hotel Valley Ho invited me into his kitchen to observe Service firsthand, I jumped at the opportunity!  Cafe ZuZu, set in the historic Hotel Valley Ho on the Western edge of Old Town Scottsdale, is a hidden gem. Not only are the grounds nostalgic but the food is fantastic and the atmosphere relaxing.  I entered the kitchen towards the end of "Happy Hour," and got the grand tour from Chef Currid. One thing I noticed immediately was how small the dry storage and walk-in refrigerators were, indicating freshness of ingredients through rapid use.  In the kitchen, Chef Currid can be found on the line, sleeves rolled up, preparing dishes and directing his kitchen crew, care and experience ensuring every dish goes out true to concept.  What I was most interested in was the food and Cafe ZuZu does not disappoint! Beginning with happy hour small plates priced at $3 each ($5-$6 is what I would have expected to pay for these delights), I ate my way thru Chef Currid's cuisine.  Chicken drumettes fried to a crisp, golden brown, lightly seasoned and served with bourbon honey dipping sauce got things started. These plump little chicken tasties were a pleasant break from the ubiquitous wing and paired with what can only be compared to liquid gold (honey bourbon sauce), are a must have!  Walking through the kitchen earlier I had noticed a HUGE herb crusted prime rib roast preparing to spend a few hours in a hot oven, this meat found it's way onto the next plate as a Prime Rib dip sandwich.  Shaved nearly paper thin, topped with melted cheese and placed atop a crusty baguette, complimented by a rich, flavorful jus and horseradish mayo, this sandwich delivered far in excess of $3 worth of flavor!  There's something about grilled cheese that's comforting but Cafe ZuZu takes it to a whole different level with their Artisan grilled cheese duo.  Crunchy, buttery sliced baguette topped with melted Brie cheese, crisp green apple and fig jam, these little jewels are absolutely packed with flavor, texture and are about the best thing to pass my lips in recent memory! (simple, elegant, perfect and at $3, the best deal in the Valley!)  No happy hour menu is complete without good bruschetta and Cafe ZuZu does not disappoint. Bright red, juicy tomatoes, fresh basil and Parmesan cheese are combined to make this classic, simple dish.  As happy hour ended, the first of the dinner appetizers went past my fork. Butternut squash ravioli ($10), followed by Prince Edward Island Mussels ($10)  The giant al dente ravioli stuffed with creamy butternut squash, topped with sauted diced squash, looked and tasted lovely! A quenelle of pumpkin cream melted into the dish providing the perfect accompaniment and a touch of micro greens for color an texture rounded this dish out nicely.  There aren't too many things better in my opinion, than a plate of mussels in a rich, savory broth. Paired with spicy Spanish chorizo, ZuZu's Prince Edward Island mussels, tomato and fennel are just devine! Did I mention the white wine and garlic broth?  As my time in Chef Currid's kitchen drew to a close (and the button on my jeans began to strain dangerously), the evenings featured dish found it's way in front of me and a fresh fork materialized in my hand.  Tender Sauted beef tips, garlic roasted potatoes, roasted root vegetables including beets, parsnip and even a little Brussels sprout sneaked in (I'd never have believed this would be one of my favorite vegetables), all on a rich port wine reduction, perfectly executed and absolutely delicious. Find a rainy day, order this dish if it's available and prepare to be satisfied.  A roasted tomato and goat cheese casserole ($9.50) went by too fast for me to divert and get my fork into but from the looks of it and after having sampled the previous dishes, I'd bet it is worth a return visit.  All in all, my time as an observer in Chef Currid's kitchen at Cafe ZuZu was well spent. The cuisine is far beyond what you might expect of a typical "hotel restaurant," and absolutely worth investigating.  Whether you're looking for a generously priced happy hour delivering food far beyond expectation or a gourmet meal without pomp and circumstance, Cafe ZuZu delivers!
A great veggie omelet with squash, sun dried tomatoes. asparagus so fresh it must have been grown locally. Endless coffee cup and superb service. I rate this restaurant a ten and I will be back.
Delighted with service by Alex and the interesting flavors. Excellent robust coffee. Colorful retro decor. Valet parking service. Will definitely return.
The happy hour is really really bad quality anf very small portions. Was not what I expected. The patio area is nice though.

Celebrated NYE here last night.. we all had a very good time.. cool decor, loads of eye candy and well priced comfort food, cant go wrong.. well mostly.  For whatever reason the waitress ordered all of our food at one so guess what? All the food came out at once.. I was pretty ticked off about this as the same thing happened at Cheesecake Factory (haven't been back, yuck!).. a place of this caliber sending out salads on top of entre's left me scratching my head. So my fillet sat there and got cold while I finished my salad.. sent it back. The chef came out (WOOF!) and talked to me about the timing which I thought was very cool.. he ended up making me a special plate of the most yummy braised lamb served with creamy grits.. both were awesome and I hate grits.. I was cleaning the plate with a fresh made dinner roll.. was great!!  The pastry chef made the entire table a sampling of desserts.. he makes lemon meringue pie just like mom.. plus being cute as a button.. well you know me, I'm a sucker for a chef!   If it weren't for the chef I would have banged this place badly due to the timing issue but his charisma and charm won me over.. well, actually it was the lamb!!

This is the best breakfast in Arizona. The atmosphere the service and the food are exemplary of times past brought to the future. Everything on the menu is thoughtfully planned and carefully executed and expertly served. You feel special when you have breakfast here! Bacon and poached eggs with creamy grits and chilled tomato juice while dining with friends makes a memorable meal! The smoked salmon platter and red velvet waffles are sublime.

We had a nice weekend here for a business retreat and the hotel definitely has a nice flavor to it.  Ahhhh, dreaming of sleeping in and ordering some room service again.  Sigh. Okay, so upon arrival we had lunch at ZuZu and both ordered the Ahi Tuna Salad.  I've been eating pretty clean in preparation for the weekend pool party and endless mojitos, but this salad didn't make me sad!  It was delicious.  Another great item was the shrimp spring rolls.  Very light and tasty.  I would definitely recommend this place to a friend.

We stopped in for Restaurant Week and sooo glad we did! We had reservations for 7pm but got there early and was promptly seated in a great little corner booth. My boyfriend and I each had a cocktail and looked over the restaurant week menu (you can also order off the full menu as well). Everything looked great on the restaurant week menu so we each decided on ordering off of that. My boyfriend started with the Coffee Rubbed Bison Carpaccio and I had the Lobster + Asparagus Anson Mills Grits and both were OUTSTANDING! I am craving mine still. We then both settled on the Wagyu Flat Iron Steak. Normally we bot get something different but we were both craving that. It was soooo good. The portions were HUGE too! I couldn't finish all of mine. Then for dessert we both settled on the Lemon Meringue Posset and it was so refreshing!   Our server was excellent as well.   It had been years (since they reopened in the early 2000's) and that was the last time I had eaten at ZuZu and it was not impressive at all hence why I had not been back in years but after this dinning experience we will certainly be back soon whether for cocktails and apps or dinner.

Super tasty brunch (not a buffet). I highly recommend banana pancakes (banana pudding between the layers), tasty big bacon, homemade cinnamon rolls are buttery sweet goodness, and the bloody mary's are spicy and yummy. One tip- on Sunday's they have a build your own bloody mary bar for $5. On Saturday its $6.50.  Nancy is an amazingly attentive waitress and their manager Tina is willing to assist in any way possible. I will be back!

I love coming here because I feel like I'm in the show Mad Men. That's the style of the entire hotel though. I like sitting at the bar and I still get great service. All the food I've had their is very good.

Loved this place! We sat outside by their fire pit & had dinner & drinks. The bartender Sean was very nice and recommended tasty drinks. Their HH is great. I had the tomato & goat cheese casserole and ate every last drop! It was very tasty! The ZuZu burger was very tasty as well. Comp valet was nice! The Valley Ho hotel is very trendy and cute! Will definitely visit again!!!

I LOVE ZUZU & the Hotel Valley Ho!  It seriously feels like a step back in time - to the 70s (or what I would imagine the 70's would be like) every time I come here. I brought my best friend from out of town here for brunch and we had a great experience. First off- we were sat at a comfy booth inside and given water. The server took our drink order (mimosas) and came back with OUT OF THIS WORLD chocolate chip scones! They were delicious and we ate every crumb. My friend ordered the eggs benedict and I got the red velvet waffle. I tried her eggs benedict and it was awesome. My waffle was good- just a bit of a sugar overload since we had had the scones. I can't wait to go back to ZUZU!!!

extremely cool spot. polynesian, trendy, contemporary, retro....and full of well-dressed "mature couples", extremely hair gel-ed scottsdale dudes, and giant breasted, ultra mini-skirted scottsdale girls. i fit right in with my Old Navy/Target wear....  i havent' had PBR in a while, so i decided to go with that. too bad...something was wrong with their keg device so that was unavailable. so i opted for a limeade which was alcoholicly tasty. the app/happy menu is limited for vegetarian...only 2 choices, but the little grilled cheeses were awesomely tasty.   our waitress, poor girl, couldn't get anything right when we went. we asked if the chili had meat in it and she said no, so we ordered it and it was FULL of meat. luckily our dining partner ate meat so she chowed on that.   overall, cool ambiance and great for googling over people who are better looking, have more money, and more well dressed than me, but if you don't eat meat, have something to eat before you go and enjoy the drinks....
Service is average but great environment . Dinner menu is delicious and drink menu is good. Part of hotel valley Ho so highly recommended if staying at hotel

We decided to try out ZuZu for a weekend Brunch and finished with mixed reviews. We were seated immediately, but it took quite some time for a server to come and take our drink order. Someone else brought our drinks out and we then sat again for an extended period waiting to place our order. Finally a different server came and stated that they were taking over our table, odd but we were happy to finally order food.   The menu had so many options that I wanted to try. I decided on the breakfast burrito which was topped with green chili pork and a side of roasted potatoes. The flavors were amazing and everything went perfect together. I was surprised at how large the portions of all our meals were. It is nice because you are definitely getting your money's worth, but might be to much food for some people.
The waitress was super nice and very helpful and the food came out amazing. Thank you

Amazing food here.  Don't know if the lounge is officially part of the restaurant but it's the same kitchen!  The Gniocchi is the best I've ever had!  Melts in your mouth good.  It was served with kale, bacon and mushroom cream sauce.  Amazing.  Looking forward to having that again when I return in January!

This is a review for the Chef's Table Wine Tasting dinner with Clos du Val.  Bang for the Buck: 4/5 - the tasting dinner was nice and with the wine reasonably priced. I will go back.  Decor: 3/5 - a bit retro 70s, not my thing but done simply and it was fine  Ambiance: 3/5 - the room is open so not much privacy but the booth we were in gave a bit more than most spots  Service: 5/5 - they were great in all ways... very attentive, the wine flowed well; I had a bit too much :)  Food Quality: 5/5 - all was excellent her; top notch  Food Quantity: 4/5 - could have used a bit more on the plates... if I had not drank so much wine I would have still been hungry  Food Flavor: 5/5 - it is rare I give 5 here but this place deserves it on this meal. Everything was perfect!  Food Uniqueness & Creativity: 4.5/5 - very creative, perfectly paired flavors and in the right proportions.   Last Experience...  02/07/2011  Herb-Dusted Seared Ahi (braised tuscan kale, meyer lemon oil + pancetta) - amazing! honestly the best Ahi I've ever had. The herbs did not overpower but complimented  Warm Orange Braised Fennel (baby spinach, shaved red onion + parmesan croutons) - very good, could have used more fennel as that was a bit lacking in qty.  Flat Iron Steak and Duck Sausage (sweet pea tortellini + shiitake mushrooms) - perfect flavors, perfectly cooked. Would have liked to see one more slice of steak and more sausage... normally I'd have still been hungry  Chocolate Truffle Cake - this was the only item that was not great, it was so-so. flavors were average, and the cake part was a bit dry.
Love ZuZu for breakfast. Love the people, the food, the atmosphere.  I feel like I'm on vacation whenever I visit this place.

This past Thrusday, i had the privilege of meeting Chef Russell, as he catered an event in honor or my deceased husband, by way of Honor Brewery. The food they put out for us was tantalizing, with options for all tastes, whether picky or open-minded. Chef Russell spoke to me and offered his sincere honor and respect for my husband and for being allowed to participate in the event. If you ever want great food and terrific service go see Chef Russell at Cafe ZuZu.

Planks & Eggs: Good   I personally didn't love it, but, it was good. For me, I think it was too much going on and it didn't taste great altogether.   The Panna Cota dessert was ok, wasn't my favorite either.  The drinks were fab -- bellini's and bloody Mary's and breads/Jams were flavorful!

Food gets 4 stars but I'd give service a 5! This is a cool restaurant, feels like you're going back in time a little bit with the ambiance of the hotel. There is a nice indoor and outdoor seating area. Service was quick and our server kept checking on us which was nice! We went for brunch and there were some great options! A little bit of everything, some unique options too. I ended up getting the crispy Belgian waffle. My mom and sister got omelets and my BF got a red velvet waffle. We also shared a cinnamon roll and I tried out the mimosa bar! Best thing I had was my waffle. Only thing that was weird about it was there was dried cherries on it, I thought that was an odd topping also it didn't say that on the menu. My bfs waffle was a little too dense but otherwise yummy. My mom and sister liked their omelets! The cinnamon roll was a letdown..looked amazing but just was super bread-y, like not at all gooey like a cinnamon roll should be. My mimosa was delicious too, the mimosa and Bloody Mary bar was cute. Overall a good experience!!

So we were going to a show at Stand Up Scottsdale - and pulled our our trusty yelp app trying to find something within walking distance.  ZuZu was close enough that it was worth trying.  It took us a while to figure out how to get in (located near the lobby of the Valley Ho hotel) - but once we did, I had to shake my head as I thought I was stuck inside the movie Casino.  The decor / ambiance looked almost exactly like DeNiro & Sharon Stone's house in Vegas.  This instantly calmed me - much like warm milk.  Even though we only had about a half hour, the waitress made a couple spot-on recommendations (Beef Stroganoff & Pork Chop) - and after checking in on yelp we even got a free glass of house wine!  I'm not often in Scottsdale, but will be back due to the delicious food and retro ambiance.  Well played ZuZu, well played.

I love this place. The moment you walk in you feel like you're on vacation... In mad men. Which to me is perfect. But along with the relaxation comes the amazing food. I've been here for brunch and had the infamous red velvet waffles and I've also had dinner here a few times. All the visits have been spectacular in both the service and the taste of food. In fact, I chose this place as my birthday dinner and bring every out of towner here if that says anything on how much I like it! The only thing I wish I could skip would be the valet. As a side note, I've also been to the spa here and had a great experience getting a facial.

Went there last night to celebrate my birthday with some of my gal pals.   We ordered off the happy hour menu and sat in the lobby.    Had a great time -- as always!   They had the orange breeze; I think they liked it cause they had two or three each.   We ordered the fries, the guac and chips, the soft pretzel and the calamari.   All of it was good.   I think my favorite was the fries.   I liked how they were seasoned.   Everything was good.   Since we were celebrating my b day, we asked Charlie the server which was the biggest so we could all share.   It was great!!   YUMMM!!   Practically licking the glass.  Unfortunately, I don't remember the name and it's not on the website's menu.  I have been here for HHs in the past and I will definitely return.  Sit in the lobby or outdoors -- if weather permits.   It's great for people watching.

ZuZu's has a decent enough menu - we liked the kale salad and another time, I liked the spaghetti squash. My boyfriend liked their wines.  We ended up eating here 3 times during our stay at the Valley Ho hotel.  The food wasn't high end, but the prices weren't either.  The best part about about the whole experience - one day we had a waitress named Kate. SHE was terrific!  Really charming, efficient, fun.  I'm writing this review for her.
We loved the ambiance of ZuZu. The breakfast was delicious and the staff was very friendly.

I wrapped up my stay at The Valley Ho by grabbing brekkie at Cafe ZuZu before heading out. Everything was delicious from the coffee to the farm fresh eggs, yummy bacon which could NOT have been more perfectly cooked and delicious sourdough. A lot of their ingredients are locally sourced so my brekkie was really a delicious conglomeration of all the goodness Arizona has to offer. What made this brekkie out of this world however was the Frosty Ho-Jay which is fresh squeezed Orange Juice blended with Vanilla gellato. I swear, my eyes almost rolled back in my head it was THAT good. Orange Julius can kiss my ass after this cosmic experience. Fantastic. I highly recommend Cafe Zuzu...if nothing else DO NOT leave until you've had the Frosty Ho-Jay. I can't believe I enjoyed a drink that much that had no alcohol in it.

Check in for your free dessert!  A group of us decided to walk from Tortilla Factory to Zuzu to get some drinks. When we walked in, we were pleasantly surprised that the place looks like it came out of the 70's with the decor and the lights.  Service was friendly and the atmosphere was good. Our group ordered drinks and we hung out for the rest of the night. I ate the key lime pie and it was really good. Maybe a little too rich, but it's not a bad thing.  It's off the main area of Old Town Scottsdale so it's tucked away and more quiet. :)

Located in the Super Duper Valley Ho Hotel is Cafe ZUZU, just like stepping back in time, the decor is spot on with groovy tile tile, slick furniture, cool ass round booths, and bitchin' lighting.  The rock walls jutting in from the outside and the windows are reminiscent of the my home growing up.  The food was Delicious and the service was exceptional.  I had the ZuZu burger with fresh hand cut fries, I love a good burger and this did not disappoint.  The Chef thought my fry order was a little little light so he sent out more.  I just wish there were more places like this, paying attention to the details and service taking it from great to Fabulous.

Cafe ZuZu has a great happy hour.  However, you haven't experienced the best part of this restaurant until you've been to one of their Monday night chef's wine dinners.  This last Monday we were at a dinner featuring Cline Cellars' wines.  The dinner started out with a lobster risotto paired with a pinot gris.  Lots of lobster over creamy risotto was the perfect start.  Next was a warm mushroom and leek salad.  The Cline Cashmere blend wine might have been our favorite of the wines.  The herb roasted lamb chop with goat cheese and pine nut ravioli was outstanding.  For dessert we were served a peach bread pudding paired with a late harvest mouvedre.  What an outstanding finish to a fabulous meal.  Get on their email list for upcoming dinners.  Chef Wiley is one of the most talented chefs in the Valley and these dinners really let him show his talent and creativity.  At $52.50 per person they are a steal!

I am beyond excited to be writing about ZuZu for my inaugural Yelp review!  Ok, maybe I'm late to the party on this one, but what a great little surprise to find in Scottsdale! It's at the Valley Ho which makes you feel somewhat cliche, retro and chic to even be there.    The bar area is a great place to hang out, grab a drink after work and watch all of the characters of Scottsdale parading through.  I went on a Monday night and it was very quiet, but I can imagine how it picks up on the weekends with the pool scene.    Here's the rundown...  Happy Hour... great deals on food and drinks and it goes until 7pm!  It's rare these days to find a HH that goes until 7pm, so I'm already a fan.  Service... our waiter was great and the perfect mix of helpful, funny, but not overbearing.  I always appreciate a waiter who gives honest opinions of menu items and doesn't just say he loves it all.  He was very personable and happy to let us just hang out and take our time.   Food... Truffle Fries - great but won't change your life...it's a great snack to share with the table but don't jeopardize another decision for the truffle fries.    Grilled Cheese - delish!  It comes with truffle, arugula and roasted tomatoes so it isn't your classic grilled cheese.  The arugula flavor was a little overwhelming but I'm also not the biggest arugula fan.  The grilled cheese is cut into 3 cute little pieces so it's perfect for sharing with the table if you don't want to fully commit.  Mussels - great and definitely worth ordering!  The mussels are extra large so you don't get as many pieces as usual.  The broth is unique with a coconut curry flavor and perfectly toasted bread for dipping.    Kale Salad - moved into my top 3 in phoenix!  I'm a big fan of kale salads and I've tried them all.  This kale salad falls in line after LGO and True Food.  It has pears, roasted tomatoes and bread crumbs to add the perfect finishing touch.    I hope this helps guide you a little and avoid menu anxiety at ZuZu! The rest of the menu looks equally amazing but I didn't have the space to try it all.  I'm looking forward to going back for brunch very soon to try the bloody mary bar and red velvet waffles!

I came here for Arizona Restaurant Week and it was absolutely delicious. You need to try it out the food. The cooks made it very delicious and the service is amazing. I know it's kind of pricey but it's worth it.
Just came from the ZuZu.....ended my Christmas Day w / a fine Bailey's & Coffe made just right !  Nice folks in the lounge; great staff working hard to ensure everyone else has a good time.....

Great retro ambiance. Food and service both excellent.  Seared ahi tuna app was the best I've ever had.  Excellent apps and cocktails, and the braised short ribs with glazed carrots were delicious as well.

What a delicious new menu! There's a new executive chef in town and the food on this new menu was incredible! We had a large group (10) and they were very accommodating. There is a bar area, a medium in door area and a rather large outdoor seating space. We came in for a birthday dinner and everyone was impressed with what they ate! I had the foie gras and the brussel sprouts! I was able to share both and still had plenty to eat. I tasted the lobster grits as well. I highly recommend getting! The service was great, the food was great and the ambiance was relaxing, yet chic. We had a night we'll never forget. At the end they were able to split the checks for us and gave the birthday girl a very cute dessert with a candle. I'll be back to try more food for sure!

Great food choices for AZ Restaurant Week. The burrata appetizer was amazing. The scottish salmon was also excellent, great flavor. And last but certainly not least, the chocolate dessert was very tasty, and the right size portion after a big meal.   We sat outside which was nice, but a bit loud at times when two groups of somewhat drunk people sat down nearby to drink some more. I guess that's what you expect from this hotel and it certainly looks like it can be the scene. The inside of the restaurant looked cool and I think that's where we'll sit next time for a quieter dinner.

I've been to Caf Zuzu a handful of times now... mostly for drinks, once for dinner, and most recently for breakfast.  I've never been disappointed and I'm sure I'll continue to be a frequent customer, especially since I'm now living so close-by in Old Town!    I recall that they have some tasty martinis on the menu, but most recently I enjoyed a glass of Cakebread Sauv Blanc - you can never go wrong with that!  Chef Chuck Wiley does a fantastic job in the kitchen as I've both dined in and experienced his culinary creations around town at some foodie events.    Since my latest experience at Caf Zuzu was for breakfast, I have to dedicate a paragraph to that... wow!  I'm hesitant to share this since I don't know that I want the word out about this, but Caf Zuzu's breakfast rocks!  I was there with Andrea R (the morning after the pARTy), and our meal was divine!  I was leaning toward ordering their wheat pancakes served with fruit butter and a side of egg whites but Andrea was torn between their yogurt and granola and the same pancakes... So, our waitress suggested we order both and share.  Sold!  She ended up bringing us each half portions of pancakes, egg whites, granola and yogurt - and the half portions were plenty!  The granola was some of the best I've had and everything else was pretty damn delicious too.  I washed mine down with coffee and water and Andrea had some OJ with hers... We sat outside for a while after we finished, talking, working, and taking in the fresh air.  The manager, Paul, came out to check on us, and he even helped me carry my computer inside once we decided we were ready to go...   Caf Zuzu is especially convenient when staying at the Valley Ho, but I now see it as a local dining destination as well.  I'm already looking forward to that granola for breakfast next time I visit!

I've been there for happy hour several times and the appetizers and drinks are always delicious. I also love the 60 's modern decor and the fact that it's in a old hotel that used to be frequented by quite a few celebrities from Hollywood's golden age.

I have mixed reviews on this place so the stars reflect the positive and negative of my experiences. The good Bartender: amazing pours, great price for the glass and quick to serve.  Food: really good, there wasn't much after three sittings that I didn't like a little pricey but quality matched it  The bad:  Service, all of the experiences were poor and demonstrated a lack of direction and training. First experience, totally ignored after being seated but table next to us had drinks before we were acknowledged. Drinks were forgotten then partially served. Then finally received the food which was great!  Had to ask for service, silverware, cleared our own plates, asked to have the order taken 2x manager noticed it (after we cleared) and helped but didn't say a darn thing.

Had to get the kale salad again, I just needed it.  I LOVE that salad! My Mom had the truffle grilled cheese and it was outstanding! I wasn't a fan of the twice cooked fries, they ended up being dried out.  Our waitresses were so friendly, and free valet was such a plus!

As hotel restaurants go, this is a great one. Funky vibe, really friendly service and good food. The bacon wrapped dates were delicious. And, by checking in on Yelp we got free dessert. An AMAZING milkshake with an Oreo the size of your fist!

While I never know what to expect from a hotel restaurant, I was pleasantly surprised by how good of experiences I had at ZuZu. At the hotel for four days, I had breakfast here twice, and also enjoyed lunch on two separate occasions (though at the pool rather than in the restaurant itself). All meals were pretty dang tasty, and the price was right.   Let me tell you this: I am pretty obsessed with eggs benedict. When I saw the California Benedict ($13.00) on the ZuZu breakfast menu, I knew its destiny was to be in my belly. In liue of the traditional canadian bacon, it is served with avocado, tomato and spinach. While I guess you could argue that this makes it healthier (and thus more 'California' than a typical benny), when I scraped every last drop of decadent hollandaise off of my plate I certainly didn't feel like it was health food. Instead, I was indulging in one of the bests benedicts I've enjoyed in recent memory. It was so good, I had it for both breakfasts  For my poolside lunches I tried two different meals: The Famous ZuZu Burger ($12.50) and their turkey club. the ZuZu burger was stellar, with crispy bacon, balsamic onions and Maytag bleu cheese. It was cooked pretty much to my liking (maybe a TOUCH over the requested medium rare) and made me a very happy camper. Served with pesto mayo, the turkey club ($12.00) was good but not really all that memorable. I opted to upgrade to fries on the side, which cost me $2. I thought that was pretty weak, as fries are such a basic side, and they weren't fantastic fries by any means.   Service seemed fine at the restaurant, though sometimes a bit inattentive. I mean, nothing to get worried about and it's probably good for me to be reminded to slow down on occasion, but still sometimes I just want the check, you know?   As with everything at hotel Valley Ho, I'm ultimately quite impressed with ZuZu and look forward to being able to return.

*** Do not go for anything other than Saturday/Sunday brunch and early evening drinks unless you enjoy overpaying for drab food and you love disappointment. ***  That was for the "short reviews" crowd as that will be the central theme of this review and the most important point when discussing Cafe ZuZu, which is the gorgeous space inside of the Hotel Valley Ho.  ZuZu's brunch is absolutely fantastic, rife with comfort foods and thick cut bacon and midwestern-inspired dishes from kitchens with rosy colored grandmothers.  Its what I would imagine, in the matter of setting, decor and nourishment, Frank Lloyd Wright would sit down to every morning and gaze out into the world.  In the case of Cafe ZuZu, one is able to watch out of the glass paned wall into the area of the 50s inspired patio and pool area.  The bloody mary is very serviceable.  Not the best I've ever had, but very delicious to go along with fruit topped french toast.  And again, that bacon!  After brunch long passes, is another good time to re-enter into ZuZu .. for evening drinks on the patio.  With firepits roaring on chilly nights, its a very pleasant setting for a group of friends intent on a mellow night of chatting.  No ones gonna blow it out here, but its a nice spot to grab wine, beer, or specialty cocktails (which, come to discover taste like Pine-Sol and shit).    Anyway, ZuZu is a pretty unique spot in that you can start both your morning and your evening there before romping around Old Town.

Cool hotel bar in a cool hotel.  Get a booth and enjoy the crowd.  Be sure to get a cocktail or four at the hotel lobby bar before dinner during happy hour.  Cool place and glad we checked this place out.

Great restaurant and certainly recommended as a must see and do when in Scottsdale. The atmosphere can be best described as 60's retro. I highly recommend the Beef Stroganoff. Our server, Kate, was the best part of our meal.
