I haven't a single bad word to say about any the cocktails taste-wise, although the more frou frou drinks seemed a bit light on the pour.   Three dollar beer, wine, specialty cocktails and appetizers? A frenzy of (relatively sophisticated) gluttony? A mere 15 bucks. Cafe Zuzu is my new go-to for happy hour!

Excellent food in a mid century hotel that has been renovated back to its 1950s roots. Ask for the casual bar menu in addition to the dinner menu for lesser priced options. Blue cheese dressing is out of sight. Great place for outdoor dining while looking at the lit palms.

Amazing. Green pork chili with eggs (perfectly cooked) was out of this world - deep in flavors but not too spicy. Loved it. This kitchen can cook an egg, scrambled, over easy, poached - all perfect. Frittata was excellent. The walnut/cranberry toast and the homemade English muffins were delicious. I dream about the walnut/cranberry bread. So was the homemade jam - WOW.  Beef stroganoff is good - a little al dente but the meat is so tender and the sauce is top notch. Same for the filet mignon. Excellently prepared. Just wonderful. Mr Muscle had the braised beef short rib served on vegetables and mashed potatoes. Claims it was one of the best meals he has ever had. We also tried the special one night, a mac and cheese (with poblanos chilis, corn, fresh tomatoes.. yum!). Its ALL SO GOOD.  Pass on the pancakes, not so wonderful, trust me on this one. Austin, Chelsea, Anna, TJ - everyone working at the bar and the restaurant are a jewel in the crown here. Eat in this hotel's restaurant - you will not regret it.
ZuZu not bad , not bad at all... I'm glad your out there in the desert doing your modern retro thing. I've been to the Standard on both coast and your doing it better...

Wow. This was one of my favorite places to eat ever! I made a group reservation on Open Table a few weeks before the actual dining out during AZ Restaurant Week and by the day of, it had dwindled to 4. They weren't offended or upset and were quite nice to accommodate our smaller group.   Since I'd never been before, I was unaware that they have free valet, so I parked on the city streets. Not a bad little walk, but next time I know better. The lobby opens into the ZuZu bar area, but the actual hostess stand is tucked a bit back there [maybe it should be moved up closer?]. A manager and a hostess greeted me both quite warmly and directed myself and one of the girls to a table. Zach was our server and was amazing from the beginning. He gave us his personal favorites on the menu, both drinks and food wise. Made us all laugh at how much he loves peanut butter and their PB dessert on the AZRW menu!  The ambiance is totally trendy, but with an ode to the 1960s/70s. Around 7/8p on the weekends, you'll find some good background music. Totally adds to the environment. This would be a great date night selection.  I started with the New Fashioned cocktail. I typically prefer vodka or gin-based cocktails but this one rocked my socks. Both Zach and the house manager PJ recommended it. On that subject...can I just say how nice PJ was?! He came by our table a few times throughout the night to check in on us.   One of the girls ordered the Mac n cheese as an appetizer as an addition to our AZRW sides. I'd never had mussels before and absolutely LOVED them. If it wasn't looked down upon, I probably would've drank the broth straight from the bowl. A little disappointed at how small my main course filet was because I wanted more! It was delicious. Out of our group I was the only one to get the Panama Cotta for Desert. Might've been the best course! So rich and sinfully good.  I can totally see myself coming back but maybe actually stay the night at the resort too.

Located in Hotel Valley Ho, this is a fun place to have breakfast or brunch.  They have seating inside or out on their patio near the pool.  The hotel has a retro-the Jetsons sort of vibe to it.  There are lots of healthy choices on the menu.  I ordered their egg white omelet with spinach and broccoli and it was pretty good.  The cinnamon bun is huge and great for sharing.

The wife and I needed a vacation and we heard Hotel Valley Ho was awesome.  It is awesome.  We wanted breakfast and decided to check out ZUZUs and we loved the experience and the food.  They had a fun 50s feel with a modern flair.  We both had the Denver omelette and it was VERY tasty of a normal omelette. The people were awesome. Go check it out.
Excellent service, everyone's food (party of six) came out within a reasonable time of each other. Great bright and boisterous vibe. Hip place for breakfast or brunch!

This hotel restaurant is a terrific example of how Yelp can synthesize with an invested business and promote a great experience. ZuZu is a gem. Fantastic retro style, unique culinary approach, fresh food, good service and a relaxed, casual atmosphere for evening dining. It's clear from other reviews that management is invested in keeping it that way, something I love to see. It's important to know that people are listening to the customer base.  I checked in on a Friday night and received a complementary glass of Pinot Noir that paired nicely with one of the specials, fish and chips. Five battered nuggets of white fish nestled themselves next to an inspired take on tartar sauce: fresh cabbage and light cream sauce, nothing thick or mayo-ish. Fries came separately in a lined basket accompanied by a delicious red chile dipping sauce and good old ketchup. Nothing too greasy, which is usually the issue with this dish, I loved it.  I'll be back in October, and I'm looking forward to the much lauded breakfast. Great to know that the fantastic accommodations of the hotel are backed up by a seriously unique and enjoyable dining establishment. Cheers!

This place is fabulous. Try the ZuZu burger, better than most, the chefs have excellent attention to detail. Ambiance is a splash of the Jetsons mixed with the Brady Bunch on vacation. Bar looked nice, sexy, tattoo'd clientele, beer selection was average but the menu cocktails were 100% originals. Recommended.

Located right in our hotel and they have a cute outdoor patio with a fire pit off the bar area.  $3 happy hour specials, yummy food and drinks!  It was a great spot to start or end a night out with a few cocktails outside.

Cafe ZuZu is now, quit possibly, the best burger spot in Phoenix.  Cafe ZuZu's has always been one of our go-to spots in Scottsdale. The innovative menu, decent prices, and mid-century modern decor has made it a favorite with our friends and extended family for years.  They have always had a solid burger selection, although we usually went for something else as there's no shortage of enticing items on the menu. (The truffled grilled cheese was memorable.)  But in the last few years, ZuZu has really upped their burger game. The cafe has entered, and won, an annual burger cook-off, with the winning entry ending up on the menu for a year. The latest winner, the Merlot Melt, is a masterpiece and I've ordered it every time I've eaten at ZuZu's since I saw it on the menu in March.  I was recently preparing my mouth for another Merlot Melt when -- Bam! -- the waitress hands us all a burger menu. A Burger Menu!!! Cafe ZuZu now has a second menu devoted entirely to burgers, and what burgers they are.  After much deliberation, I started with the Hangover, and it was AMAZING. A juicy hamburger patty, sharp cheddar cheese, jalapeo, onion rings, and a fried egg. I kid you not, it was stunning.  Now I have to go back to try the other five or six new burgers. I can't wait to experience the Bayou Burger, the PB + J Burger, and the Smoke Stack Burger.  For those who might object to paying $16 for a burger, I have three words: Worth. Every. Penny.  The price is made a little easier because the burger-menu burgers all include Cafe ZuZu's famous twice-fried fries (which are extra on the regular menu). I also recommend taking advantage of the Burger & Beer option, which gets you a draft craft beer for $4.   Update: We went again last Sunday, only to discover that the burger menu is M-F only. So you'll have to clear some time during the week. #burgercraving

My fiance and I are both VERY new to town (like 1 week new) and we both have an eye for mid century modern design and architecture. I had read some great reviews about the place..so without hesitation, I made us a reservation for Friday night at 7.   We came early and got a drink in the lounge. I love that their happy hour goes to 7, I feel you don't find that at a lot of places. I was surprised at the fact that it wasn't super busy. Friday night.. swanky spot in Scottsdale.. surely there'd more people but perhaps we're onto something by going to a hotel restaurant that I'm sure a lot of the locals forget is there.  We were taken care of and the food was out of this world. I ordered the Salmon and it was amazing..so smokey! Not to mention, the ambience is PERFECT. I felt like I was on an episode of Mad Men. It really takes you back to another era. So cool!  We will definitely be back. My fiance and I both agreed we'd love to take family and friends here when they come to visit!

I had Christmas dinner here. The waiter was excellent. The room was beautiful and decorated with style for Christmas. The entire staff was in great Chett. I order the crab bisque and the prime rib. Both were sensational and went well with the champaign. For dessert, the chocolate Torte was excellent.

Took two others to Zu Zu for lunch yesterday (Saturday) at noon. Ask for a booth and were about to be seated when I noticed that of all the booths available, hostess was about to seat us beside a four top with a crying infant and two year old.  Requested a different booth and she accommodated, and we were given a "brunch menu". Waited a while to be noticed, but eventually we we served water. Again waited for someone to notice we wanted to order.mFood came out, but we had to request utensils. Fruit side looked excellent, turkey sandwich okay, but accompanying chips were stale and Eggs Benedict served on tough pastry of some sort which I could not cut with my knife.  Side of cheesy grits was inedible.  Requested and received small oven baked potatoes instead. No one offered the complimentary chocolate scones mentioned in other recent reviews. If I had known, I would have asked for them because we certainty paid for them. All in all, a disappointment, because we are considering purchase of an expensive condo across the street and really wanted to like this place.  Have been searching for the happy hour menu without luck. A fond memory of staying at the Valley Ho. Upon arriving Phoenix three decades ago.  The place still has an excellent, fun vibe.

If you're looking for something retro, and want to feel like you just stepped into a scene from Mad Men, this cute lounge is for you. Unique drink selection, and a great patio for hanging with friends.

I love the decor and uniqueness of this mid century vintage hotel. It's like walking back to the late 50's. Be sure to check out the great pictures above the lobby on the second floor. I also enjoyed the gym, big bathtub in room, and the over funky fun color scheme! Be sure to check this place out.

We have enjoyed coming here for years. Recently, with the arrival of a new cook, the food has taken a turn for the worst. The quality has suffered in an obvious attempt to cut costs. The service however has gotten better. We will not be returning
The atmosphere is amazing, the staff is so friendly and amazing. The sangria is made to order, you can order is less or more sweet. One of the best Happy Hour I've been too.

Cafe Zu Zu...I love Yu Yu! Those were some serious BBQ Burgers I took back to room 6106. Lathered in a perfectly sweet, tangy and mildly peppered sauce with thick slabs of bacon and Vermont cheddar, or was it Wisconsin...not sure...but it was sharp and we all know cheddah makes it bettah! While the mayem and madness of putting together a fashion show unraveled in our room, I sought refuge on our private patio with my new friend (the burger) and it's sidekick (homemade chips!)....I devoured and enjoyed each morsel. The bread was soft and crispy on the edges! Heavenly I say. The signage for Zu Zu is a little Weird Weird...I thought it was Trader Vic's as I saw two signs for TV and none for ZZ! Didn't care, the decor was warm and modern with big puffy cotton ball lighting dotting the ceiling. Hostess and bartender were warm and modern with big puffy cotton balls...oh, wait...I digress...edit...the manager put together my order with a minor mislabeling of medium well and medium rare. Sorry Rickie...I know you don't like the pink spot. Hey. Clean it up yelpitas. I liked the menu I perused while waiting for my chow, enjoyed the decor and service...Cafe Zu Zu easily gets two, two thumbs up I say...Up Up!
We are locals that used to eat here often for breakfast. Quality of food started to go down and more often orders were not correct. Took off out list of places to go for breakfast on the weekends.

The Food, I had the hamburger and the husband had meatloaf.  I thought the burger was decent and my husband said his meatloaf tasted like mom's meatloaf dipped in butter, then deep fried, and drenched with gravy. Comfort food not at it's best  The atmosphere, Uhmm..  let's see how can I best describe the atmosphere?  Take a trip back the late 60's and let's take Miami, San Diego, Cabo, and put it in a martini shaker and pour it right smack  in the middle of Old Town Scottsdale and you get Hotel Valley Ho.  Definitely a party scene.  Service-  The waiter did not seem to have any real opinions about the food, just that it was all wonderful.  In summary I would return for drinks, and fun, not the food.

Great place for the unique requirements we had last night. We needed wifi and wanted some wine. So we stopped in (before the Yelp Rocks event in Scottsdale) and found just that. Sat down in the lobby bar and fired up the Mac. We were thrilled to find favorites on the wine list and more excited when the cheese plate we ordered arrived at our table. Great cheeses with fresh breads, fruits and a sweet spread that topped it off. Our favorite cheese plate in town right now.

I have frequented ZuZu a lot over the past couple of years, but my experience last night was very disappointing.    I tend to meet there with a group of ladies (5 or 6 ladies minimum up to 10 or so) on a semi-regular basis.  Last month, when I made reservations, I was told I didn't need them if we were eating/drinking from the Happy Hour menu.    We typically order off of the Happy Hour menu, and I've never had a situation where this has been an issue.  Last night, when I arrived, I asked for a table for 6 and was told if we were eating off of the Happy Hour menu, we could sit in the lounge chairs by the bar or the cocktail tables outside.  It's 100+ degrees these days; so, we pushed some tables together and made do with the lounge area though the regular seating area was dead.  This was irritating but nothing to complain about or to bring attention to.  Our server, however, was rude.  We ordered fries, which she forgot to bring with our meal and we had to follow up about.  They were SO SALTY that I wish we didn't order them.  Another lady ordered a coke, which didn't arrive and she had to ask for again.  There was no apology for the mishap with the Coke.    We had 6 people, but one of the ladies in our group had her drinks paid for by her husband who was at a different table.  Technically, this left us with 5 ladies/5 tabs, which she gave us an attitude about when we asked if we could split our tabs.  She did (begrudgingly) split our tickets, but the tickets had an error on them and had to be corrected.  We were charged for a Chardonnay instead of the Coke.  The gratuity was charged twice on another ticket.  It was avoidable mistakes, which should have been caught.  Overall, the level of mistakes and the attitude from our server left a sour taste in my mouth.  I usually really enjoy my experience here but will remember this next time I am looking for a night out with some girls.

The Beautiful Carin and I stayed at the Valley Ho to celebrate my birthday this week! I turned 40 for the first time (after many years of celebrating my 39th birthday, it's time to move on and "grow up":) Caf ZuZu is the in house restaurant at Valley Ho and a genuine bright spot in an already terrific hotel experience.  ZuZu is named after the little girl in "It's A Wonderful Life", the movie that's on TV 2-3 dozen times each Christmas.  What that has to do with the restaurant is unclear, but they had to name it something, and ZuZu works for me:) I think we all know that hotel restaurants can be an "uneven" experience, but that's not the case with little ZuZu:) We have eaten at ZuZu's before, over the years and always found the food and service to be very good and very reasonably priced (esp. for a hotel restaurant, where the prices and service often reflect the fact that they think you are captive to their $15 tuna sandwiches and their $20 omelets). ZuZu's is reasonably priced and they serve a great meal! This visit, I had a BLT with an over easy egg on it...I didn't really think you could improve on a decent BLT...I stand corrected! This sandwich has a touch of genius! I also tried their truffled grilled cheese and club sandwiches...wonderfully made...fresh tasting ingredients and great bread, well prepared eaten poolside with a couple of martini's...now that's what I call a hearty breakfast:) Fresh cut fries and fresh house made potato chips are a great accompaniment to the meals. The menus are creative and I have yet to have an unhappy experience at ZuZu. Whether you sit inside at ZuZu and listen to Frank, Tony and rest crooning along like it's 1960 again, or have your lunch at the pool and listen to Pearl Jam, Priest and the Boss, ZuZu is a good time:)

ZuZu is the utterly fabulous hotel bar/restaurant in my favorite hotel of all time, so how can I not grant them 5 stars?   Expect more of that Mid Century vibe you encounter in the glorious hotel lobby continuing through ZuZu's chill lounge and restaurant's interior. The dining room is large and sports some comfy round booths, which I love, and the patio is the perfect place to enjoy your meal alfresco. I've spent time in the lounge, too (of course I did), which is very swank 60s jetsetting into the future. I like. I very much like. Heck, the Hotel Valley Ho is the stuff of architectural and design genius in its entirety. I wouldn't expect anything less of ZuZu  Although on the whole, the staff ranges from decent (yet maybe not the most on the ball when it comes to remembering that you've asked for something) to totally on it, I have to give special props to Sharon, who's the best breakfast waitress, like, ever! You could swear that she's purposely conjuring up the no-nonsense but loving vibe you'd expect from Madge at the diner back in the day, but no, there's nothing contrived about her. She's an absolute asset to this restaurant and stands out as someone you'll be recommending that people request when they are planning to visit.  Onto the food: I hate eggs and rarely if ever eat them, but I'll be damned if I didn't order that garden veggie omelet three times (egg whites only) on my past two stays. It's super fluffy and stuffed with seasonal veggies and goat cheese. Perfection! Side of grits, yes, please!!!  A special note: What happened to that spectacular cheese plate?! No, seriously, I was looking forward to returning just for that and now it's apparently no longer on the menu. Sadness! Read Aimee K's review for the deets on this plate. We were both incredibly disappointed to learn of the menu update. I'm not even going to tell you about how amazing it was because I don't want you to get your hopes up. But for the love of god, please, pretty please, ZuZu put it back on the menu!  I don't know if they do the same Happy Hour in the fall (I didn't see mention of it?) as they did in the middle of the summer but I felt it was outstanding. Cheap glasses of wine and specially-priced apps (including, *sob* a smaller version of the aforementioned cheese plate).   Roooooom service!!!! As in 24-hours! Another perk of staying at the Ho. It's prompt, and friendly and well, you can't argue with a good guac. It's the side of sauteed spinach, however, that still has my mouth watering. And memories of that cheese plate enjoyed back in July.  Sigh. I really need to get over it.
6 years later and the beef short ribs are still amazing! Now, time for some chocolate cream pie!

I met my parents here on my birthday for their happy hour! It was a great choice because we had a great time and enjoyed some delish eats. Our server was nice and tried to get us everything as quickly as possible. It was busy so she had to bust her butt working the floor, kudos to her. The retro decor is a lot of fun and makes for a difference experience.   So we almost ordered everything off the happy hour menu, you really can't go wrong with what you order, it was all great. Actually the only thing we did NOT get was the Asian Glazed Chicken Wings. Everything else was easy to share and nothing was left on any of our plates!  As for drinks, I went with my favorite drink which I was happy to see on their menu, the Bramble. It was strong but not so strong that it was hard to drink. My dad had the Haboob which was equally as strong.   Great drinks, great food, great service.

ZuZu was awesome. A good friend took me here for my birthday. Our server was Sharon and she was great. She was attentive, polite and answered our questions professionally. She was on her game as I suspect most if not all of the servers here are. The staff seemed very polished, nice. There are a couple things that actually pushed this review over a 5 Star. And I don't throw 5 Stars around like a lot of Yelpers. First, the butter that is served with the bread was cool but not frozen, so it was easy to spread on the delish rolls that come before the meal. Second, I ordered an Iced Tea and it came with a small container of simple syrup. Yep, sugar water. Why oh why can't every place do this. Awesome. This is probably the single most impressive concept I've run into in awhile. Most, if not all sweeteners do not dissolve in cold liquid. Anyone who uses the pink, blue, yellow, white, brown or green packaged sweetener can attest to this. The only reason I use the one I do is because it's the one that dissolves the best in my iced tea. Ahhhh, but not here. The simple syrup was awesome and my tea tasted great. On to the food. I had the Hangover Burger. This burger comes with crispy jalapeo, cheddar cheese, onion strings, topped with chorizo and a fried over-easy egg. They schmear a smoked chile aioli on the soft bun. I ordered mine medium rare and it was pretty close to that. The only negative would be that the crispy jalapeo's were not crispy at all, barely even toasted really but that didn't effect the taste one bit. The bun was soft, the chorizo was properly cooked, the egg was spot on and the onion strings were not greasy and fried perfectly. Winner winner Hangover burger dinner.  My friend had The Famous ZUZU Burger. He ordered his rare and unfortunately it came out a bit more medium rare. It was close and I'm sure the cook was just nervous about sending out a rare burger. Regardless, he ate it and said it was a good burger. The famous ZUZU has smoked bacon, balsamic onions and blue cheese crumbles on it. We both got the house made potato chips which were awesome. Sharon brought us some catsup and ranch dressing for dipping.  All in all, a very nice experience. This will be my new place in central Scottsdale to grab lunch.  Great Service. Great Food. Great Experience. 5 Stars.

My family loves this place. They have stayed here and eaten here just a couple of times, and have always had a great experience with the staff, service and food. Today was my first time here and as I love the feel and the decor the staff and service was pitiful. We called 2 days ago for a Sunday brunch reservation. We got here a little early and we're sat right away. It being Sunday things were crazy, people everywhere, and tables are placed so close to one another to fit as many as possible. And for me that's fine, not a problem. We were sat outside right next to a indoor window, thankfully there were umbrellas on the patio to shade everyone, except us. As time went by the sun started to hit us. We asked for an umbrella and about 20 minutes later nothing. A member of our group had to get up to look for the manager who came and tried to move an umbrella for us, taking shade away from other people. Eventually we asked to move to another table which we got a reply of those are for people who reserved with us. Uhhh that's us! We move hearing snide comments from the people around us. Okay cool we finally have shade. High of 96 today btw. When we first were seated (in our first seats) about 6 of us order the Bloody Mary/mimosa bar. Sooo we get to our new table and our food comes out about 10 minutes before we even get our drinks, which we have to get up and leave our food to prepare. One things for sure the food is fresh and prepared well. Loved my veggie omelet with goat cheese and oven roasted tomatoes, would recommend it to any one it fancies. Our server seemed to care very little about how we were treated and that we were happy, Something I would think an establishment in Scottsdale would be noted on. As a results our drinks were comped and we ended our meal on a high note. (Left out a couple more instances but the were small, compared) come at your own risk and enjoy the food and atmosphere.

During our stay cation at the hotel valley ho, my boyfriend and I had the pleasure of getting to dine at cafe zuzu. We didn't have the best of experiences within the hotel itself but our two meals here were definitely good experiences. I would actually return to this cafe, even though I would probably not stay at the valley ho again. For my dinner I got the crispy Thai salad and my bf got the zuzu burger. Both were prepared well, with care and attentiveness. The ingredients were fresh and zesty and everything was plated nicely. Our server was a bit annoying at first and then he disappeared until it was time to deliver the food and pick up the check. He reeked of cigarettes, but aside from the server, our meal and experience was wonderful. We even ate a small bite for breakfast the next morning and again, everything was delicious and fresh. I love that I live less than a mile away from this place, so I'm sure I will return. But I will ask for a different server, that's for sure.

Cafe Zu Zu has been a decent place for larger groups.  Most times the service has been spot on but the last time I was there (2 weeks ago) the service was slow.  We were sitting outside and the inside looked pretty dead.  I think our server was about to leave until we came rolling in and then she had to stay.  At least that was the vibe I got.  The food was good though.  I has the cheeseburger, it was really good.  We had the cheese plate for an appetizer and it was just so-so.  Others indulged in mash potatoes, macaroni and cheese and some salads.  They all seemed content with their food.  I really enjoy the bar in Hotel Valley Ho.  Very chill and cool.

I typically avoid eating at the hotel I'm staying at, but after pulling up Yelp and seeing the reviews for ZuZu I decided to give it a shot. I was not disappointed.   Casual open environment with large windows letting in the Arizona sun. There is outdoor seating as well but it was too cold to enjoy being outside.   Very friendly and prompt service with a breakfast menu that has something for everyone. I chose the coconut chia seed pudding to try something need and it was delicious. Nice blend of grains and fruits, a perfect way to start the day.   I would not hesitate to eat here again upon my next trip to Scottsdale

Went there last night for dinner with a group of girls.  When I walked in, I felt like I walked into a crappy Vegas lobby/restaurant.  Clientele was what was expected & typical for that part of Scottsdale - at the bar were a bunch of "brah's" who like to act like they have money and their respective female counterparts.  Restaurant area was slightly older crowd - especially with the waitstaff, which I thought was unfortunate.  I expected the server to be a hot babe...girl or guy.  Instead, it was a 50-something-year-old woman with no social skills. The food was also pretty gnarly.  We ordered probably 6 or 7 appetizers before we ordered meals.  I only tried a couple of them - specifically the "warm maytag blue cheese fondue" with potato chips.  ICK.  The dip was horrendous tasting and looked like what my husband calls a "wax dart" if he hasn't, you know, for a while.  The chips were really greasy and just tasted like a potato dipped in oil.  I also tried the "oven roasted tomato and goat cheese casserole" with herb toast.  Another ick.  The toast was alright, but the casserole was like bruschetta gone wrong.  I ordered the "Grilled Chicken Piccata" with the butter sauce on the side.  It was alright - way too much salt and the seasonings tasted off.    I don't know, perhaps I went there with the wrong expectations.  I thought the atmosphere wouldn't be as cheesy and I expected to eat "comfort food", not food I wanted to secretly spit into my napkin.  I'll never go back.

Let me start out by saying that if I was rating ZuZu based off of the food alone, I'd give 4 or 5 Stars. Unfortunately, some other factors pulled it down. We stayed at Valley Ho, and experienced ZuZu 3 times, for drinks at the bar, for late night drinks and deserts, and then again for brunch. The bar was great - drinks were very good, with creative cocktail options, and good service. Deserts were good, but I felt like they looked a little bit better than they tasted. I'd give them a 7.5 on a 10pt scale. The brunch is what knocks my rating down. We showed and, despite a decent number of ready/open tables, we were told it was a 15 minute wait, then, 15 minutes later, we were seated at one of those tables that had been open that entire time. Not a huge deal. But then it took forever just to get water and order drinks. I'm not sure if the waitress was flustered about something or just forgetful (restaurant wasn't very busy at this point), but she got my wife and I's drink mixed up less than 3 minutes after we ordered. Then it took forever to get her to come back to order food, and then after that it took quite a while to get the food, which didn't come out the way we ordered it the first time. It was eventually taken care of, but as you can tell, the whole experience from arriving to receiving our food seemed like a bigger ordeal than it was worth. One we had our food and everything was correct, the food was great - no complains at all there! But after we finished, it was back to the waiting game: my wife left and was at the pool for 20 minutes before the check was actually brought over to me.  An improvement to the service at the sit-down dining portion of ZuZu could easily add a star back to my rating.

I'm done with restaurant week. I don't understand restaurants' line of thinking. Instead of showcasing good food, they often choose to go the cheap route. My friend and I decided to try zuzu tonight because of their tasty looking menu. We got there early and had a drink in their bar. I had their blackberry mule, which was fine. My friend had a blackberry/gin drink that was terrible. She said she'd had better on mill (which is not a compliment). Regardless, it was happy hour and the atmosphere was fun so we weren't too worried about the dinner.   We were seated outside, which was cute with a fire pit. For dinner, my friend had the butternut squash soup, shrimp pasta, and goat cheesecake. I had the wagyu beef, the new York strip,  and chocolate dessert. The soup was fine but was oddly topped with marshmallows...those needed to be removed. The wagyu beef was tiny but easily the best item on the menu. My real problem was with the entrees. My 'new york strip' came out and looked like a cut of mystery meat in a cafeteria covered in gravy and sitting in a pool of blood (ugh). The first bite of meat was all fat and gristle (actually had to spit it out). I'm not sure on what planet this counts as a new York strip. The waiter asked if our meals were good and I told him not really... I asked him to clarify the cut of meat and he told me that they cook their new York steak like a prime rib in a big slab and shave off pieces for each plate.....ummm they probably should mention that on the menu. I don't like prime rib because (like this meat) it tends to be gelatinous and lacking flavor. Talk about bait and switch. He offered to replace the meal, but I didn't want any of the other restaurant week dishes either. My friend's pasta essentially tasted like buttered noodles with overcooked shrimp. Yuck. She said lean cuisine was better. The desserts were also a massive failure. Goat cheesecake tasted awful (and I love goat cheese)... Chocolate dessert was hardly chocolatey at all. I felt completely mislead. I would not come here again nor recommend it to anyone beyond happy hour.

The best way to describe Zuzu Caf is "eh". I can't put my finger on what exactly made the experience so blah- it was a combination of the lethargic ambience, mediocre food and average drinks. That being said, there was also nothing terrible, thus the three stars (I probably would have given 3.5 stars if had the opportunity). I dined here on a Friday for lunch and I have heard that Saturday is much more lively and exciting. At the very least, I would give this place another chance on a weekend for brunch.

We ate at Zuzu during Arizona Restaurant Week.  I had the shrimp and scallop cocktail which was very delicious. A friend had the Caesar salad which he said was good. For entrees two of us had the short rib and one friend had the Asian salmon.  Both entrees were quite delicious and good portions. For dessert we had the chocolate cake and the key lime pie. Both were quite delicious - with the key lime pie being very light with a good lime taste.   Service was phenomenal - very attentive server - and the place is so great looking - love the retro look!  Also a big fan of the Red Flower soap in the restroom - great smelling and quite fun name after recently watching The Jungle Book!
Having the most amazing Green Pork Chili  Breakfast Burrito on the planet.  Come one, come all, this food is amazing.

Very disappointing!!! We went for Easter lunch and everything was awful. Bad service & bad food!!! Kale salad with salmon was blah & salmon was not cooked. Shrimp cocktail had no flavor & were not cleaned properly...yuck!!! Dry French toast & served without maple syrup. When the syrup finally came the toast was cold! Eggs Benedict was okay but nothing to rave about. Would not recommend!!!

Solid 4-star establishment. While the service is pretty hit or miss (shoutout to Molly, the awesome bartender and Bloody Mary master), the food is consistently above average with lots of options. When I'm feeling healthy, I opt for the Kale salad and Zuzu Smoothie. If I'm embracing the DGAF nature of vacation, I'm going for the stuffed brioche french toast. Great happy hour deals, excellent desserts (I had their coconut cream pie EVERY NIGHT I stayed at the Hotel Valley Ho recently), and enough variety to satisfy every type of palate. They make it pretty difficult to leave the resort grounds when food this tasty is right in the hotel.

Food is good but service is terrible. Three times now we have had the same old, trashy looking waitress. My boyfriend hit the nail on the head when he said "'Uhh, she should be working at a WAFFLE HOUSE. Not at the Valley Ho!"  We made reservations and they said they would do something special for our anniversary. They did nothing, the service was horrible, and the waitress looked like she was doped up on tranquilizers. She didn't smile once, or even seem nice. Awful.

Since my initial review, I've been back to Cafe Zuzu many times. This is definitely one of my favorite places to go.   I recently discovered their potato gnocchi. Holy cow, this stuff is amazing!! I'm not a mushroom fan, so I had them sub in heirloom tomatoes, and what a great decision that was! The sauce that they're served in is so sweet and creamy and the parmesan cheese shavings on top are the perfect accent. You've got to try this dish before they take it off the menu (think it's seasonal).  I also recently discovered their fantastic happy hour! It goes until 7, so there's plenty of time to take advantage of the specials. They have a whole menu of specialty drinks that are only $3, in addition to a great appetizer menu. We're planning on going this Friday to take advantage again!

To say I was excited to try this place would be a huge understatement! I will say... the food was great!  And that's why I gave it 4 stars! I wanted to like our server so much, in fact I did like him, but his service was another story! Had to ask multiple times for water when all 4 of us were out! Every time he said he'd be right back... he wouldn't come for 10-15 minutes! We asked for two separate checks and that took about 20 minutes, and he came back and had mixed them up, and they were significantly different prices. Like i said i was cheering for him, but it was just mistake after mistake.

I stopped in today for bunch with my boyfriend and was waited on by Eddie. We were seated promptly, with a smile, given the yummiest scones ever, and just had all around good service. I got the California eggs Benedict (which isn't on the menu anymore but i saw a gentleman eating it and HAD to ask!!) and my boyfriend got the steak and waffles. The food was AWESOME and the staff was even better. The manager even came to check on us to see how our food and experience was. She has a professional, positive, and friendly demeanor. We really enjoyed ourselves and will definitely be back!!

This is a place to go, just so you can say you've gone.  It's really beautiful to walk the grounds of the hotel and this restaurant is one if the best parts of the whole place.  All seating is at tables and while there are areas that could work for larger parties, this is a place that specializes in 4 or less a table.  Business lunches, retirees and folks who are staying at the hotel is your normal mid-week crowd.    The service is absolutely perfect - balancing that reserved resort restaurant demeanor with the upscale casual ambiance of the place.    Gotta tell you, I'm not amazingly impressed with the food.  It was very very good - but with all the hype, I'd just anticipated a bit more.  But the decor totally made up for it for me.  Very cool.  Personal note - I love their match boxes!  They are so cute I almost always have one in my purse - and I don't even smoke!

We stayed here for a staycation and it just happened to be restaurant week as well. We had a great time at the pool. The staff was pretty rude by the pool though. They close about 6. They give you no heads up or last call so when we asked for another drink, the server actually said..."you can try the bar if you want". Cool, thanks...is that where you get drinks? Im in the pool. We went upstairs, showered and changed. The room was very nice and clean but a little confusing to find...again, we ran into a staff member who had no idea where to tell us how to get to our room.  We found the complete opposite with our service at dinner. Service was fantastic! I didnt like what I ordered which was a smoked fried chicken but my dates liked the flavor of the steak but said it was a little tough. If I noticed someone wasnt eating their meal, I would've asked to get them something else but she did not so I just didn't eat. Included was an appetizer of some sort ( obviously forgettable) and a dessert of lemon tart and a lava cake which we all enjoyed. VH is only a couple miles from my house so I ended up just coming home. The other 2 friends stayed and we opted out of the pool the next day, which is an option, but the service by the pool left a bad taste in our mouth. Not really interested in giving this place my money again but I dont have to with all the local resorts having summer specials.

I must've ordered the wrong thing. Dangit. And I was so excited to try this place, too. I wanted to be bad and order the grilled cheese. But, I went with a salad. It's the Gruyere cheese that got me. I had to have it. Little did I realize that the lettuce they used would be your standard, boring iceburg. Ick. But, I did appreciate the combination of other flavors, and the thing was massive (took half with me for later).   But, since eating at ZuZu, I've decided that if you go out as a treat, don't order a salad. Order something that's going to atleast have a high start value, like the blue cheese fondue.   Anyway... Have you ever had a roll so good that you thought it was laced with some addictive illegal substance? Uh, yeah. Cafe ZuZu's rolls are UN-believable. Too bad my request for seconds went unheard. I would have even paid for 'em. Words can't capture how tasty these rolls were - warm, fresh from the oven, fluffy and melt-in-your-mouth fantastic.   Service was anything but stellar. Our server tried, I'll give her that. But she seemed a bit scattered. Good thing Paul, the host (and/or manager, not sure) came by to see how everything was... and to confess that, yes, even he is addicted to the rolls.   Will I be back? Doubtful. I hate to valet park, and it's mandatory at Valley Ho. It's complimentary, of course, if you eat at ZuZu, but even then, you have to factor in a good tip on top of another good tip on top of the price for lunch... Seems like alot of effort, doesn't it? It'd be one thing if the food were worth it, but, like I said, I think I ordered the wrong thing. Even my lunch buddy, who had a green chile burger, said the food was just okay.   Cafe ZuZu, you get Cool Kid Points for trying, but I'm docking points off for poor execution.

Living in North Scottsdale we normally don't have the opportunity to venture into Old Town Scottsdale but, recently we did and at some delightful point in time ended up here! My family and I had quite a time deciding if the interior is Mid Century - Vintage - Retro or..?! Whatever it is we all rate it as Fantastic! For restaurants in Old Town this is at the Top of my "A" List! Thanks to all the staff as well who helped make our time there even better!

Went for dinner last night. Beautiful on the patio. We ordered Scallops. Chicken Penne Pasta (2) and a veggie burger. Half price bottle of Cupcake Chardonnay. Price of a full bottle is $90. Half price $45.00. Such a deal! The portions for dinner were appetizer size.  For 3 delicious scallops, I paid $28.00. "3" Penne pasta with chicken was $20.00. Veggie burger was the best deal, $12.00. I don't plan to return.

**NOT recommended for people who like tasty food** Retro cool atmosphere with decent service. Depressing food. Seemed like our meals were pre digested for us. My child ate her lunch and cried. Even the parasol in her cocktail Ho-J failed to lift her spirits. I'm mostly pissed at the 2 hours of our lives that we'll never get back.
Our family came here for breakfast one Saturday and it was great.  Funky, retro setting, friendly servers, and great food.  Loved the granola + yogurt and the stuffed french toast.

Went to a beer pairing dinner at Zu Zu last night for THAT brewery out of Pine Arizona that was fabulous. The beer selection and Meal pairings were spot on and truly thought out. The event was well staffed, the restaurant was clean, the servers were attentive and the food was incredible. I would certainly recommend attending this type of event Based on my initial experience with the chefs offerings and skill set. I did however find it odd that we paid for our dinner at the end, I was under the impression that these types of events would have had advanced tickets sold, but what do I know. #nomnom

The dcor and ambience here is so nice. I loved the entire atmosphere and service was quite good. Breakfast here is such a treat with some wonderful choices. I definitely have to recommend the short rib breakfast - so flavorful. But... it is a very rich morning meal so beware. Outstanding experience - I'll return!

Pretty swanky little joint with a lot of character and good service... The Bloody Mary bar rocks.  Everything is fresh and good menu selection.  Crispy thick Belgian waffle of greatness is the direction to travel down after a platter of berries and dark roast coffee.

We stopped in to check out some of their new items that everyone has been raving about and let's just say that I left with a smile on my face and a very happy tummy! We shared several items- The dairy-free chia seed pudding is to-die-for... holy moly!!! The new mussel dish is incredibly flavorful and the biscuits and gravy will make your tastebuds dance. Delish!!

We sat outside and the first thing I noticed was a spider crawling out from either my napkin wrapped flatware or the menu they set in front of me. I murdered him with my water glass in front of the waitress and she didn't seem too concerned with disposing of the body. His corpse remained on the table for the rest of the lunch...  The atmosphere is pretty nice... I've been to the Ho quite a few times since the remodel and I kinda like it. The douche-factor is quite high here... in fact, you might step on the premises and think that this is the factory where they make douches. Anyway, it's fitting that the front lawn smells like shit this time of year. It smells like they fertilize it with dog and human turds. It looks beautiful at least. I have to smell the lawn because I would rather walk the driveway than have to valet park with those half-wits.   Back to the food - we first had a fondue and chip starter... potato chips with a cheese dip? It was both tasty and awful at the same time. I questioned the freshness of the cheese after a few dips, so I stopped dipping. The chips tasted like they came out of a bag, but they were also quite greasy. With their dip, they clearly should've gone with multi-color tortilla chips made from fresh. At these prices, they should be able to afford it.   For mains, I had a Caesar salad with grilled chicken and my lunch-mates both had fish tacos. I found the salad to be quite bland - the dressing was clearly from a tub and the chicken was rubbery and overcooked and dry. This place doesn't cook from fresh from what I can tell - all pre-packaged and frozen. The tacos weren't fishy in a bad way, but the verdict on them was that they were just okay.   The prices aren't outrageous, but they aren't cheap either and for what they charge - they should offer better food. I was disappointed. The drinks in the Ho bar are grossly overpriced. I guess if you have to eat here, you won't die.  This place is so average, it deserves a 2.5/5 instead of a 3. No need to avoid, but nothing to rave about.
Came here for brunch. Food was OK but service was very bad: very very slow and missing part of our order that was pretty simple...

Okay, first I must say how unacceptable it is that I have never been here in my 30 plus years living in Phoenix. My BBF lives right down the street and I have passed by the darn place for years. Was so mad I missed the reinvention of "Vics" when it was open here for a bit. I cried when I heard it closed. Well it was nice to finally visit and eat here beyond the Grilled Cheese and Mac and Cheese throw down of course. (They beat my friend's husband but I won't hold that against them. My friend thinks I should though--JK --;o)-- not really, but sort of. lol)  Well this place has a lot of cheese and fish on the menu so I had a hard time deciding what to eat since I am not a fan of either. I so wanted to try their specialty burger but I despise Blue Cheese. A big sigh, since it sounded so great, all other ingredients considered.  I finally decided on the Kale salad with chicken and a side of fries. It was pretty good.  The bread they serve is yummy too. I loved their fries. The sauce they serve with it is Delish!  We went here last night with my NY club and to celebrate a wedding that took place over the summer. I can not speak more highly of the delightful waitress. Sorry I did not get her name but she is an ASU student who has a father that is a professor. Gooooo Sun Devils!  I want to thank her for her kindness. ( she knows why)   All the staff that I ran into were superb and friendly. The bar staffers were efficient and helpful, ( Mytry-lol) even the front desk folks gave us a big wave as we exited the place. The Valet said not one word about my messy car so that deserves a shout out in itself. In all that rain I felt a tad bad for them last night.   I love the retro feel of the lobby and patio area. I can just imagine Frank and Marilyn walking outside.  The restaurant is a bit on the pricey side for those watching pennies but pretty equivalent to the other places to eat in Scottsdale. In conclusion, I would like to go back again and perhaps book a Staycation.

Love this place!!! They have an amazing happy hour, with prices you can't beat! Great atmosphere and really helpful staff!   Sometimes the cocktails are a little off so I've decided to stick to wine when I go there but this is a great neighbor spot that I think some locals miss out on!

Wow.  A place where I can go with my whole family with no complaints!  Even though the menu has many items that qualify as "comfort food", all of the dishes have a modern twist.  The menu has some old standards like meatloaf and pot pie, but you'll also find dishes like seared ahi tuna salad and some wonderful small plates.  While not the most focused menu, it has a lot of options that are all executed very well, making it the perfect place to bring people you don't know or people you do know who do not share you're taste in food.  It's a crowd pleaser.   Service was great.  No complaints.  Reservations recommended.

I ordered a Filet Mignonette and it was absolutely delicious. However, the appetizer, Ahi Tuna, was a bit disappointing. It was overcooked and tasteless. The service was only average but the bill already includes 20% gratuity. I will definiately come back here again for a happy hour but probably not for dinner.

I have had enough of waiting for 45 min to get seated at a trendy breakfast joint that takes forever.  Eggtastic, breakfast club, fill in the name of a place where you sweat outside until a table opens up. That was such a lame thing to do in 2002, I'm no longer permanently hungover with limited options. We came upon this restaurant when we stayed at the hotel. It's beautiful! The restaurant at Valley Ho has great ambiance, comfortable seats, delicious and nicely prepared food and great service. We now go here for breakfast whenever we are in old town Scottsdale. I love their ice tea that comes with a cup of nectar and lemon juice with a mint leaf. For my meal I order the BLT add fried egg with a side of home made thin cut crispy potato chips. I love sitting in their cozy booths and people watching.  I'll be back... sans hangover next time!

Wow. I literally had the best waffle of my life here. It was the Belgian waffle with the dried cherry butter. I could not stop cursing throughout the meal because it was so good. I had my friend taste it as well and his eyes lit up like a dried out Christmas tree, so I know it's not just me. He had the eggs benedict and also enjoyed it. It had a great (possibly house made) English muffin along with avocado and perfect little poached eggs. The fried potatoes were also crispy and perfectly seasoned. I also indulged in the DIY bloody mary bar, which was delicious. There were a lot of ingredient options and even bacon! I would just say that they need to add Worcestershire sauce and they'd be golden. The service was good and prompt and the staff were all very friendly. It is clean and the building is beautiful. I can't wait to go back! [$30 for two people]
